For 20 years Saima’s husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired.

Saima has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition, but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a 53 year old married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a business  selling vegetables in the Philippines. Luciana has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 29 years old and a responsible mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband, two daughters, and one son. Her husband is an auto mechanic and has been running a workshop for 12 years. 

Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband requires some new tools for auto repairing so that he is able to repair the automobiles more appropriately and efficiently. Her husband would purchase new tools with the loan amount. This would increase his net income and earnings and many of their financial problems would be solved.

Sumaira is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for automobile repairing.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. For additional income, she operates a general store. Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She is requesting PhP 17,000 through NWTF in order to purchase materials for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Saiqa Group

texts.en:
Saiqa is a 31 year old mother of one son and two daughters. She is living in one of the poorly developed area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store since 2009 and wants to expand it by purchasing more goods. Because of financial constraints he finds this difficult. 

For that reason, Saiqa has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan, for the growth of her husband's general store. He would purchase items like bread, eggs, detergents, washing powder etc., for his general store .This will help in increasing his sales and his monthly income. She is hopeful that the loan will result in a positive and productive outcome for them so that they can lead a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for the general store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 1 year and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 14 and 8 years. They are both going to school. She has 3 additional dependents who live with her to assist her in the business. In 2007, Kadiatu established her business of selling sets of pans, dishes, bowls, spoons, flasks, glasses, plates, cups, knives and pots, etc. She began her business because she dropped out of school because her parents did not value girls' education. She was used instead to assist her mother in business.  

When Kadiatu got married, her husband gave her initial capital to start a business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1,568,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy sets of pans, dishes, bowls, flasks, glasses, plates and cups. In the future, Kadiatu plans to acquire a bigger shop, educate her children and build a house.  

This loan will help to increase her stock and generate more profit. One challenge is that some items do get damaged when transported. She is a hardworking businesswoman. She thanks you for supporting businesswomen. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sets of pans, dishes, bowls, flasks, glasses, plates and cups.

loans.name: Savzhumor

texts.ru: Савзхумор 55-летняя разведенная женщина. У нее четверо детей. Она с сыновьями и невесткой живет в Яванском районе. Савзхумор добрая отзывчивая женщина. У нее среднее образование. Савзхумор имеет 15-летний опыт работы в области вышивания женских национальных платьев. У нее имеется две швейной машинки, и сейчас она хотела бы заново начать свою деятельность. Савзхумор планирует заняться вышиванием и продажей национальной женской одежды и штор. Она нуждается в кредите для приобретения необходимых тканей для вышивания.
texts.en: Savzhumor is a 55-year-old woman is who is divorced.  She has 4 children.  She, with her sons and daughters-in-law live in the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  Savzhumor is a kind a sympathetic woman.  She has received a higher education and has 15 years of experience embroidering the national women's dress.  She has 2 sewing machines and now wants to re-start her business.  Savzhumor plans to make and sell the national women's dress and quilt.  She needs a loan to buy necessary fabrics to begin.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics

loans.name: Neolito

texts.en: Neolito is 53 years old and married with three children. He lives in Calamba, Misamis, Occidental. He owns and operates a cocoa farm in the local community to earn a living. He has been in business for more than eight years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. His dream is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Haybulla

texts.ru: Хайбулла 45 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 несовершеннолетних детей и 1 совершеннолетнего. Хайбулла очень добрый человек и поэтому его семья очень любит его и дорожит его. Хайбулла вместе семьей живет в сельской местности, далеко от центра города. Он более 5 лет предоставляет местным жителям услугу таксиста. Хайбулла является единственным кормильцем в семье, так как его жена домохозяйка и его дети еще не работают. Хайбулла старается, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование и поэтому он создал условию, чтобы его сын мог продолжать учебу в университете. Хайбулла должен оплатить за учебу сына в университете, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для оплаты учебы сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Haybulla is 45 years old, married and has 4 children who are minors and 1 who is an adult.  He is a very kind person and his family loves him and appreciates him very much.  Haybulla and his family live in a rural area far from the city.  For more than 5 years he has been serving the local community as a taxi driver.  He is the sole provider for his family since his wife works in the home and his children do not work.  Haybulla makes an effort so that his children can receive a higher education and he has agreed to make it possible for his son to continue his studies at a university.  Haybulla should pay his son's tuition, but he has no money.  He is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to cover the costs of his son's education.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education at university

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 35 years old and a hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and a son, who is studying in third class. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For 8 years, Sajida has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products like makeup kits, facial scrubs, nail polish etc and some fancy chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Sajida has requested for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting the profit, first of all she would repay the loan amount and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвинозу 20 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Сарвиноз очень умная и целеустремленная женщина. Она учится в 4 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции по специальности экономиста. Сарвиноз в свободное время читает книги и смотрит интеллектуальные программы. Она всегда старается расширить свой кругозор и будущим стать хорошим специалистом. Муж Сарвиноз работает в организации ИМОН и в этом году он не смог оплатить за учебы Сарвиноз, так как у него было много расходов. Сарвиноз запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sarvinoz is 20 years old, married and is raising 1 child.  She is very smart and ambitious.  She is in her fourth year at Tajikistan State University of Commerce studying ecomoics.  Sarvinoz reads books in her free time and watches intellectual entertainment. She always tries to expand her horizons and to become talented in her field.  Sarvinz's husband works with the IMON organization and this year he was unable to pay her tuition because of his small income.  Sarvinoz is asking for a loan of $550 to pay for her university studies.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education at university

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 11 years. Jenalyn earns more income from a general store.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Adela Elsa

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 63 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Adela no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Adela trabaja como ayudante en una peluquería, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de bocaditos a pedido, ella trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Adela se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Adela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina e insumos para poder preparar los bocaditos que vende, de esta manera Adela podrá exhibir sus dulces para atraer a más clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran negocio de bufet.
texts.en:
Adela is a 63-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her son, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who does everything to get her family ahead as she has always had to be both mother and father to her son.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of money and the need to work from a very young age to help her parents, Adela was not able to pursue the business administration degree she wanted.  In her free time, she likes to watch the news and sometimes she makes a delicious carapulcra con sopa seca pork stew to share with her family.

Adela works as an assistant at a hair salon on her own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication.  She also has a small business preparing and selling appetizers on request.  She works every day and she can do it for around 10 hours.  Adela feels at ease doing her work and she believes that it is going well because of her skill and because she treats others kindly.

Adela is very thankful to Kiva's lenders as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy a display case and ingredients to make the appetizers she sells. This will allow Adela to display her candies to attract more customers.  She will keep working and applying herself to achieve her greatest dream of having a big buffet business.

loans.use: to buy a display case and ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria nació en la comunidad de Buena Vista pero vive en la comunidad de Mika. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Victoria es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía, venta de verduras y frutas y crianza de animales menores (Gallinas, Cuyes y Chanchos), ella lleva a vender sus animales los días sábados a uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco y los demás días en la comunidad de Mika vende comida de forma ambulatoria, ella tiene también varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz y otras cosas. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Victoria was born in the community of Buena Vista but now lives in Mika.  (Mika is in the Colquepata district, which is in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru).  Victoria is 41 years old, married and has six children.

Victoria is an enterprising and hardworking woman who makes a living in agriculture.  She has cattle, sells artisan products and vegetables, and raises young animals (such as hens, guinea pigs and pigs).  On Saturdays, Victoria takes her animals to one of Cusco's markets and the rest of the week she sells food as a street vendor in Mika.  Victoria also has various plots of land where she grows potatoes, barley, corn and other products.

Victoria was invited to participate in the "Intipakareq" communal bank by her neighbours because she is a happy and responsible person.  On this occasion Victoria is applying for a loan to buy manure, seeds and fertliser.  She thanks everybody for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомджону 36 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Он очень заботливый муж и отец. Его жена учительница в средней школе. Его дочке 11 лет и она ходит в школу. Илхомджон более 6 лет занимается собственным бизнесом, то есть он мясник. Илхомджон покупает скот, сам режет и продает мясо местным жителям. Так как он живет в сельской местности и конкуренция не большая. Он год за годом развевает бизнес. Илхомджон обладает хорошим знанием в области бизнеса. Он хочет развивать бизнес дальше и увеличить доход. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2100 долларов США для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is 36 years old, married and is raising 1 child.  He is a very caring husband and father.  His wife is a teacher at a high school.  Their daughter is 11 years old and she studies in school.  Ilhomjon has run his own business for more than 6 years--he's a butcher.  He buys cattle and then he himself butchers them, selling the meat to the local community.  Because he lives in a rural area, there isn't much competition.  Year after year, he grows his business.  Ilhomjon has gained considerable knowledge about this industry.  He wants to further expand his business and increase his profits.  He's asking for a loan of $2100 to buy cattle.  He awaits your kindness and assures that he will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 54 years old and married with two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 8,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 12,000PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires to have a better future. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires to have a better future

loans.name: Fahridin

texts.ru: Фахриддину 42 года. Он женат  и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети еще несовершеннолетние. Базмигул, Хосият, Аслидин и Шабнамгул ходят в среднюю школу. Жена Фахриддина домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Он с 2003 года работает в заводе, где перерабатывают алюминий. Фахриддин уже несколько год планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег для этого. Он хочет отремонтировать все комнаты, так как его дом имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, песок, краски и т.п. Это его первый займ, и он обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fahridin is 42 years old, married and has 4 children who are not yet grown.  Bazmigul, Josiyat, Aslidin and Shabnamgul attend high school.  Fahridin's wife is a homemaker and spends her time raising the children.  Since 2003, Fahridin has worked at a plant that processes aluminum.  For several years, he has planned on making repairs to his home but he doesn't have the money to do so.  He wants to renovate all the rooms since the home is currently in bad condition.  He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy construction materials like cement, sand, paint, etc.  This is his first loan and he assures that he will repay on time.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cement, paint, etc. for home repairs

loans.name: Nusrat Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 36-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and three children. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession and his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 
Nusrat wants to educate her children in good schools so that they can have a bright future. Currently she can’t send them to good schools due to the financial constraints and she is really much worried about their future. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. 
She is a very skilled woman and she wants to open a beauty parlor in her house to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She would purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, creams, facials scrubs, makeup kits etc and would also purchase some chairs for her salon. She is very hopeful about this loan as she could start her own business from this loan. In this way she could help her husband in generating some income. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children and to pay back her installments.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for the beauty salon

loans.name: Joelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Joelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buying and selling charcoal business.

Joelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Denia

texts.es: Denia tiene  35 años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos para iniciar la siembra de arroz, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto de arroz poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, por lo que solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Denia is 35 years old, married and is currently living with her husband and three children.  With this loan, Denia plans to buy supplies, such as fertliser, in order to start sowing her rice and also to pay for labour.  She plans to maintain her crops so that they do not become damaged and so that her yield is not reduced.  This way she hopes to generate more income to support her family.  Denia is applying for her first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any other loan with state banks and FUDECOSUR is providing this loan under better conditions and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow rice.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita nació en la comunidad de Mika pero vive en la comunidad de Viscochoni a treinta minutos de la ciudad de Paucartambo. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 75 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos.  
Benita es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, maíz, cebada, tarwi y otras cosas más, ella lleva a vender sus productos a uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco.  

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y amable. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Benita was born in the community of Mika, but she lives in the community of Viscochoni, thirty minutes from the city of Paucartambo (the community of  Mika is located in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo, department in Cuzco, Peru). She is 75 years old, married and has six children.
  
Benita is an enterprising and hardworking woman who works in agriculture. She has various plots of farmland where she grows potatoes, corn, barley, and more. She takes her products to sell in the markets of the city of Cuzco.  

A group of neighbors invited her to participate in the “Intipakareq” communal bank because she is a responsible and kind person. At this time, she needs the loan to buy manure, seeds and fertilizer. She is grateful to all of the people for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Hicela Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Hicela de 31 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas y foliares y poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra asi como muestra la fotografia  y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su familia
texts.en: Hicela is 31 years old. She lives with her family in a home the own. She has worked growing corn and beans for several years. With her sales of basic grains she is able to cover her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to allow her to buy fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide and foliar feed, as well as to be able to improve the land where she plants, as the photo shows. She will be able to continue with her crops to obtain better harvests to be able to make more income and have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and to do improvements on the land.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta nació en la comunidad de Tiracanchi (San Salvador, Pisaq, Cusco) pero vive en la comunidad de Ccotatoqlla a treinta minutos de la comunidad de Mika a pie de carretera. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos. 

Aniceta es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía, venta de verduras y frutas y crianza de animales menores, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta  alrededor de uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Huancarani donde expende diferentes tipos de verduras y frutas como por ejemplo cebollas, zanahorias, tomates, papa, maíz, cebada, plátanos, manzana, papayas y otras cosas más. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como verduras y frutas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Aniceta was born in the community of Tiracanchi (San Salvador, Pisaq, Cusco) but lives in Ccotatoqlla, thirty minutes from the the community of Mika close to the highway. The community of Mika is located in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. 

Aniceta is 38 years old, married and has six children. She is an enterprising and hard working woman who works in agriculture, cattle farming, crafts, vegetables and fruits sales and small animal breeding. She has a small stall near one of the markets in the city of Huancarani where she sells different types of vegetables and fruits such as onions, carrots, tomatoes, potatoes, corn, barley, bananas, apples, papayas among others. 

A group of neighbours invited her to participate in the communal bank “Intipakareq” because she is a responsible and cheerful person. At this time she requires a loan to purchase goods such as vegetables and fruits. She is grateful to all the people for the loan and she promises to pay the monthly fees on time.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jonathan Andrés

texts.es: Jonathan de 23 años de edad, es un joven de origen campesino, dedicado a la actividad agrícola y ganadera por tradición familiar. Después de aprender el oficio gracias  a su padre. Este joven considera que el momento de independizarse ha llegado, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la adquisición de ganado de levante, con el fin establecer su propio negocio y generar recursos para sus gastos y los de su familia. Su mayor deseo es convertirse en microempresario y tener la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad para iniciar sus estudios en zootecnia.
texts.en: Twenty-three-year-old Jonathan is a young man from the countryside who farms and raises livestock for a living, following the family tradition.  He learned the trade from his father.  This young man believes the time has come to become independent, which is why he is asking for a loan to invest in young livestock so he can set up his own business and generate income for his and his family's needs.  His greatest wish is to become a small business owner and have the opportunity to attend a university to study zootechnics.

loans.use: to buy young livestock

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña maria de 40 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su hijo. Actualmente vive con su hijo de 17 años es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora su principal siembra es  el maíz. Doña maria desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y darle una mejora a su terreno que muestra en la fotografia. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Maria is 40 years old. She is a woman who is very responsible with her household obligations; she has always been known as someone who provides the best for her son. She currently lives with her son, who is 17. She is very hard-working, and she has always worked with cheerfulness and enthusiasm. She is a farmer, and her main crop is corn. Maria wants to increase her sales, and for this reason she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, and pesticides, among other items, and to improve her land which is shown in the photograph. She wants to have the help she is requesting because she does not have other monetary income, and thus she will be able to keep providing the daily bread for her household without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, soil amendments, etc.

loans.name: Leala

texts.en:
Leala is an entrepreneur who has a love and passion for hair-styling. She is a veteran hairstylist with over 18 years of experience, who looks to provide her clients with fragrance-free and allergen-free hair products. Leala’s dedication to her clients, art, and work have led her to research and experiment for two years a product that would do its job efficiently. 

In 2012, Leala opened the doors to Nonscents Inc. Her products include fragrance-free and allergen-free shampoos, conditioners, styling creams, styling gels, and hairspray. Unlike the current fragrance-free hair products that are on the market, Nonscents actually does what it is supposed to do, and that is to restore, moisturize, and strengthen hair without causing allergic reactions. 

Leala is looking for a $10,000 microloan to finance Nonscents. The loan will help Leala to purchase inventory, maintain the Nonscents website, and run her business efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, maintain the Nonscents website, and run her business efficiently.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is 63 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell. Marciana has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 40 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She aspires to save enough money to purchase a vehicle and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 59-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a janitor by profession and he has a very low monthly income because of which they are facing a lot of financial problems.

Farzana is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for six years. Her clients are very happy and well satisfied with her work. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines so that her production would be increased. She would also purchase some thread and cloth for the purpose of stitching. She would pay for the educational expenses of her children with the profit. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one for her family.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia always had a passion to be an event planner. She loves her eye for perfection to make that special day for someone even more unique. She has been planning weddings and parties for her close friends, family and clients in the Tuscaloosa area for many years.

Sylvia understands the “ins-and-outs” of party planning. She has been in the business for more than ten years – building a strong clientele while also successfully managing her marriage of twenty-eight years and raising her teenage daughter. She has many repeat clients who request her expertise – so many, in fact, that she knew she would have to obtain working capital to keep up with the demand.  

Three years ago, she realized that she needed to own her own equipment and stop the cycle of renting equipment and losing money each time she planned an event. That is when she created All for U.  

The funds from Accion Texas Inc. allowed Sylvia to purchase her own tables, fabrics, a collapsible room divider and other event equipment to plan that special day for someone. She was also able to keep her two part-time employees and give them an increase in pay for their dedication and hard work. She believes her dedicated employees have been with her for many years because she is able to pay them well and treat them with respect.  

These funds allowed All for U to bring in positive cash flow and continue securing events for the future. Without the help from Accion Texas Inc., Sylvia would not have been able to accomplish all of this so quickly.

Sylvia hopes one day to own her own land and facility as revenues increase. For now, she is focusing on learning new ways to be creative with event planning and securing future events to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase tables, fabrics, a collapsible room divider and other equipment, and offer pay raises.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, age 55, runs a general store to earn an income. She sells items like canned goods, soap, spices, eggs, and soft drinks. She and her husband have six children, one of whom is still enrolled in school. Letecia works very hard to provide for her family and has been engaged in her business for two years.
 
Letecia has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more stocks to sell in her store.

In the future Letecia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, soap, spices, eggs, and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rayito de Sol está conformado por ocho mujeres responsables y trabajadoras que se esmeran siempre por sacar adelante a su familia, estas mujeres viven en una comunidad donde la gente además de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz también se dedica al comercio, es un lugar pequeño y muy tranquilo.
El nombre del grupo se eligió ya que cuando las integrantes formaron el grupo, la representante de entonces tenía un grupo musical de niños llamado "Rayito de Sol". Elvia es integrante del grupo platica que tiene 32 años de edad esta casada con el señor Lorenzo desde hace 12 años juntos han formado una familia con dos niños de los cuales solo uno estudia. La señora Elvia paltica que tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace un año y medio, entre su esposo Lorenzo y ella decidieron iniciar  con su tienda de abarrotes porque para ellos seria de gran ayuda para solventar los gastos del hogar.
Doña Elvia cuenta que cuando iniciaron su negocio no tenian nada de muebles y solo mercancia, con el tiempo pudieron hacerse de sus muebles, comenta una de las dificultades mas grandes es la falta de un mostrador mas grande donde ella puede poner su mercacia y asi darle la mejor atencion a sus clientes aunque Doña Elvia comenta "Cuando iniciamos si me preocupaba la competencia porque ya habian muchas tiendas, llegue a pensar en nuestra perdida de inversion, afortunadamente no fue así, nos ha funcionado muy bien y ya llevamos un año y medio".
Doña Elvia esta muy contenta con su negocio sueña con algun dia tener muy bien equipada su tienda de aborrotes y tenerla muy bien surtida para asi tener mejores ganancias y sacar adelante a sus niños porque quiere que sigan estudiando y tener una carrera profesional para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Todas las integrantes del grupo estan muy contentas y agradecidas con la institucion Vision Fund y KIVA por todo su apoyo y sus servicios. Las integrantes del grupo invertiran en distintas actividades, como Doña Guadalupe y Florentina invertira en sus tiendas de abarrotes, Eufemia comprara calcetas para su venta, Doña Juana invertira en mandiles, Doña Paula invertira en vasos de licuadora, carolina en controles y Doña Elena invertira en jarceria.
texts.en:
The Rayito de Sol group is made up of eight responsible and hardworking women who strive to always get their families ahead. These women live in a community where people grow corn and work as merchants. It a small and peaceful place.

The name of the group was chosen because when the members formed the group, the then representative has a children's music group called "Rayito de Sol". Elvia is a member of the group. She says that she is 32 years old, and has been married to Lorenzo for 12 years. Together they have made a family of two children, one of whom is in school. Elvia says that she has had a convenience store for a year and a half. With her husband, Lorenzo, she decided to open the store because it would be a big help in paying the household expenses.

Elvia says that when they started their business, they didn't have any furniture and only had merchandise. Over time, they were able to make the furniture. She says that one of the biggest difficulties they have is the lack of a bigger counter where she could put her merchandise give her customers better service. Elvia remarks: "when we started, I was worried about the competition because there were already a lot of stores. I even came to think that we would lose our investment. Fortunately, that didn't happen and it has gone very well for us and it has been a year and a half already." 

Elvia is very happy with her business and she dreams of one day having a well equipped store that is well stocked so she can make more profit and get her children ahead. She wants them to keep going to school and have good careers in order to have a better quality of life. All of the members of the group are very happy and grateful to the institutions of Vision Fund and Kiva for all of their support and services. The members of the group will invest in their different activities. Guadalupe and Florentina will invest in their convenience store, Eufemia will buy socks to sell. Juana will invest in aprons, Paula will invest in blender jars, Carolina in controls and Elena in cleaning supplies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beverages, eggs, milk, bread, etc.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana, a 39-year-old hardworking mother of four children, is the sole supporter of her family, as her husband died six years ago. Very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses, Sultana has been using her tailoring skills for the past six years to generate some income for her family. She is facing many financial problems right now due to low monthly income and large family size.

Sultana has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her in stitching clothes, thereby increasing production. She will use the additional profits to pay the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 30 years old, married, with two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a banana production. She has been in her business for over three years and earns PHP 5,000. 

Aurelia joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase chemicals for banana production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña maria de 56 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capasidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con sus dos hijos, Doña maria esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y darle una mejora a terreno que meustra la fotgrafia para tener mejores cosechas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, has worked in agriculture for several years and this has given her the skills and knowledge necessary to take care of her crops. Her main crop is corn. She sells her crop to basic grain agencies that are near her home. The profits obtained from her sales help her with household expenses. She lives with her two children. 

Maria is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies that help her in the planting of her crops such as manure, seeds, and fertilizers which will allow her to improve the land, shown in the photograph, to have better harvests and thus be able to have better profits and to continue helping in the expenses of her house without any limitations

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and improve her land.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 51-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice for more than 20 years now. 

In order to be able continue her farming business, Leonora requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides, to increase the volume of her harvest. In the future, Leonora would like to invest in other businesses to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia, a 46-year-old married mother of five, is engaged in a retailing business. A responsible mother, Amelia has been operating her enterprise for 20 years and wants to continue growing it. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, condiments and beverages to sell. Amelia hopes that she can obtain her loan in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, condiments and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en:
Kefaya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Kefaya is a Palestinian, married woman with no children. For the past ten years, Kefaya and her husband have been making fresh fruit juices and cocktails. They are well-known and have a lot of customers and their business is considered to be a profitable one. It is the only source of income to them, but it needs more support and improvement.

Currently, Kefaya and her husband are repairing and renovating their store and adding a fence. But, due to a money shortage, Kefaya is requesting a USD 3,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her cover the cost of making improvements, such as installing tiles, painting, and also purchasing necessary appliances, such as a blender to make fresh fruit cocktails for customers. This will allow Kefaya and her husband to improve their business and increase their income.

loans.use: to make improvements and buy necessary appliances for her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more recycled materials for her business. Nida has been in this business for three years. She also earns income from buying and selling coconuts. Nida has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for start-up costs and renovations.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un señor de 61 años quien tiene 9 hijos 6 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes viven en Sololá.
El  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, eligió esta actividad por que se trabaja por temporada ya que se obtienen ingresos aceptables por cada cultivo. De esta manera aporta a la economía familiar.  
El solicita un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para capital de trabajo que servirá para cultivo de zanahoria y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es comprar un terreno y poder cultivar en el y atreves de las ganancias que genere el cultivo,  empezar con una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Vicente, 61, has 9 children; 6 women and 3 men, who live in Sololá. He has worked in agriculture for 40 years. He chose this activity so that he works per season since he obtains acceptable income for each crop. This way he contributes to the family finances.

He is requesting a loan of 3,500.00 Guatemalan Quetzal for working capital which will be used to grow carrots and thus improve his income.

His dream is to buy land and be able to cultivate it and through the profit that is generated from the crops, open a grocery store.

loans.use: to have working capital which will be used to grow carrots.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer was born in and lives alone in Vanadzor city. She is divorced. A long time ago, her husband went to the Russian Federation for work and didn’t return. 

Varditer has two daughters who are married and live with their families, separate from Varditer. Varditer is a very optimistic woman and she raised her daughters alone. She had a very hard life, but she was never disappointed from life. 

Five years ago, she became jobless and decided to run her own trading business. She built a stall near her house and started to sell fruits and vegetables. She buys fruits from the nearest villages and from wholesale food markets and she transports them to her stall and resells them. Trade income allows Varditer to cover all her costs and bills and to live in her lovely city, Vanadzor. 

Varditer needs a loan to construct a roof for her fruit stall and to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to construct a roof for her fruit stall and to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 25 years old and married, with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy food and household goods like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, and noodles to sell. Edna has taken out and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig-fattening and fishing. Edna hopes to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante is 55 years old. He has been planting and harvesting tobacco in his village for three years. Dante is a widower, which is why he is fully devoted to his business. Dante is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his tobacco farm. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his tobacco farm.

loans.name: Rosete

texts.en: Rosete works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rosete has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business. Rosete has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosete would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Enyi Paola

texts.es:
Paola es la mayor de siete hermanos, desde muy pequeña siempre ha  tenido dificultades económicas, pero aun así siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, su madre siempre le inculcó el amor por el estudio y el deseo de salir adelante. Y le ha enseñado  lo importante que es el estudio para lograr obtener un buen futuro y una mejor calidad de vida.
Estudió la primaria con muchos sacrificios pues debían pagar una pensión y entonces cuando ella llegaba del colegio y los fines de semana  debía cuidar a sus hermanitos para que su mamá pudiera trabajar.
Cuando era una niña  tuvo una amarga experiencia con unos familiares, cuando terminó la primaria, le ofrecieron ayudarla con la secundaria y la universidad. Ante esta buena oportunidad y teniendo tan solo 10 años, ella aceptó la que parecía una excelente oportunidad, pero solo con el tiempo, y después de muchas humillaciones y malos tratos; y aunque se graduó como bachiller, entendió que había sido un error; y luego decidió volver con sus padres y sus hermanos; pues ya no estaba dispuesta a soportar más malos tratos.
Luego trató de buscar oportunidades para poder estudiar, pero parecía que cada vez que trataba de buscar, algo se interponía; era casi imposible. Si no era por dinero la mayoría de las veces entonces no tenía para el formulario o cosas así, era por algún otro requisito; en ocasiones le daban opciones para créditos o prestamos, pero no tenía quien le sirviera de fiador
Ahora ella es madre soltera de dos hermosas niñas; y trata de  luchar por brindarles un mejor futuro, pues ella sueña con poderles brindar un buen estudio y una buena oportunidad de llevarlas a una universidad pues ahora que son pequeñas, una quiere ser doctora y la otra antropóloga.
En este momento está cursando II semestre de contabilidad financiera y aunque ha sido difícil ya que no se si sea por falta de estudio o por falta de experiencia, ella no ha podido conseguir un empleo estable, entonces ha tenido que trabajar como se dice en lo que salga, como empleada doméstica, como auxiliar de cocina, como auxiliar de ruta escolar. Siempre tratando de cumplir con sus obligaciones y  los gastos de sus hijas (arriendo, mensualidad del jardín, alimentación, ropa, calzado, útiles, salud, cuotas del semestre).
texts.en:
Paola is the oldest of seven children.  From a young age she has always had financial difficulties, but even so she has always fought to get ahead in life.  Her mother always instilled in her a love for school and the desire to be successful, and she has taught her how important school is to being able to achieve a good future and a better quality of life.  She attended elementary school with many sacrifices because they had to pay a tuition, and then when she went to high school she had to care for her younger siblings on the weekends so her mom could work.  

When she was young she had a bitter experience with some relatives. When she finished elementary school they offered to help her with high school and college.  In view of this good opportunity, when she was only 10 years old, she accepted what she thought was an excellent opportunity, but with time and after many humiliations and bad treatment, and although she graduated from high school, she understood that it had been a mistake and later decided to go back to her parents and her siblings because she was no longer willing to endure more abuse.

Later she tried to find opportunities to study, but it seemed that every time she tried to search something intervened; it was almost impossible.  If the majority of times it was not for money that she did not have for the application form or things like that, then it was for some other requirement; at times they gave her options for credits or loans but she did not have someone to serve as a guarantor.

Now she is a single mother of two beautiful girls, and she tries to fight to offer them a better future since she dreams of giving them a good education and a good opportunity to take them to college because, although they are young now, one wants to be a doctor and the other an anthropologist. 

At this time she is attending the second semester of financial accounting and it has been difficult; she is not sure whether for lack of studying or lack of experience.  In addition, she has not been able to find stable employment.  Therefore she has had to take whatever work comes along, as the expression goes; she has been working as a domestic employee, an assistant in the kitchen, and an assistant along the school route.  She is always trying to fulfill her obligations and the expenses of her daughters (the rent, monthly payment for kindergarten, food, clothing, shoes, utilities, health, and semester fees).

loans.use: To finish her studies in financial accounting.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is married and works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothing and food vending. Edna is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle. Edna has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Capulines Group

texts.es: El grupo de los “capulines” se encuentra en un lujar muy alejado ya que para llegar al lugar es caminando ya que no hay trasporte para llegar es un muy grande la comunidad donde la gente se dedica al cultivo de maíz. El nombre lo eligieron porque el lugar donde se reúnen hay muchos capulines son un grupo pequeño pero que la gente aprovecha para hacer grandes cosas como atole de capulín, tamal de capulín etc. El grupo "Capulines" esta conformado por cinco mujeres y un hombre son personas muy responsables pero sobretodo muy trabajadores los integrantes estan solicitando un credito a la institucion para invertirle a sus actividades economicas como Sabina comprara alimento para sus cerdos que necesita para engordar sus animales, Esperanza comprara borregos chicos para cria y engorda, Teresa comprara materiales para su ciber cafe, Raul ocupara su credito para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes y Viviana invertira en sus productos de bisuteria. Doña Apolonia quien tambien forma parte del grupo platica que tiene 58 años de edad es una mujer viuda toda su vida ha vivido en la comunidad. Doña Apolonia platica qe con su credito quiere retomar su tienda de abarrotes anteriormente ya tenia una dicha actividad economica la aprendio porque sus padres se dedicaban a la venta de abarrotes. Tiene un hijo en E.U el cual le envio un poco de dinero para iniciar con la tienda de abarrotes pero no le alcanza es por eso que esta solicitando el credito para comprar, azucar, sal, refrescos, huevo, leche, detergentes, productos enlatados. Etc. La señora Apolonia argumenta "Tuve que cerrar el negocio porque en ese tiempo todas mis hijas estudiaban y no nos alcanzaba para seguir invirtiendole a la tienda de abarrotes" Pero Doña Apolonia esta muy contenta porque gracias al prestamo de Vision Fund y KIVA podra tener nuevamente su tienda de abarrotes.El sueño de Doña Apolonia es volver a tener su tiendita de abarrotes como lo tenia anteriormente y no tener preocupaciones economicas mas adelante.
texts.en:
The group “Capulines” is located in a remote area and you must go on foot as there is no transportation. It is a large community where the people grow corn. They chose their name because the place where they meet has many  capulines (a type of cherry). They are a small group but the people take advantage to do big things such as making capuline atole (a corn-based drink) and capuline tamales. The group Capulines is made up of five women and one man. They are very responsible and above all very hardworking. 

The members are seeking a loan from the institution in order to invest it in their economic activities such as Sabina who will buy food for her pigs for breeding and fattening the animals. Esperanza will buy sheep for breeding and fattening. Teresa will buy supplies for her cybercafe. Raul will use his loan to supply his grocery store. Viviana will invest in costume jewelry.

Apolonia who is also a part of the mentioned group is 58 years old. She is a  widow who has lived all her life in the community. Apolonia says that she wants to reopen her grocery store as she learned this financial activity from her parents who were engaged in selling groceries. She has a son in the United States who sent her a little money to open her grocery store but not enough and that is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy sugar, salt, soft drinks, eggs, milk, detergents, canned food, etc. Apolonia reasons that, “I had to close the business because at that time all my daughters studied and I could not come up with enough to keep investing in the grocery store.” But Apolonia is very happy because thanks to the loan from Vision Fund and Kiva she can once again have her grocery store. Apolonia’s dream is that her small store is like it used to be before and that she does not have future financial concerns.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, eggs, soft drinks, bread, etc.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish-vending business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over four years and earns PHP 10,000 every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy more fish and shrimp to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and shrimp to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a married woman of 23. She operates a business selling fruit and vegetables. She has been in this business for two years and plans to use this loan to buy more stock for resale. The business is located in a busy area and customers are the local residents. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Naomi is talkative and jovial and plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business. She also farms as another way of getting income.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en: Jacquelyn's primary source of income is her general store, which she has been running for almost three years. She is married and has one child. She and her family live in the village of Sto. Niňo, Angadanan. She wants to restock her store but lacks the necessary capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy drinks, condiments, assorted bread, curls, and canned goods to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments, assorted bread, curls, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more clothing, such as T-shirts, pants, and blouses. Teresita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now asking for a new loan to build her business further. NWTF is re-listing Teresita's business profile again to support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing, such as T-shirts, pants, and blouses.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She earns additional income from running a general store and vending food items. Nena and her husband have one child, and she works hard to help support the family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF.

Nena is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle and for her motorcycle transport business.

Nena hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle and for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silva tiene 30 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo  vive en el Cantón Chillanes   Provincia Bolívar.



Silvia se dedica   al comercio de animales como los cerdos.



Solicita el crédito para  el incremento de animales en el negocio  y poder comprara al contado.  



Las compras lo realiza en   la ciudad Santa Rita  Calla 1ª de junio  y  la merced.  



Su  sueño es incrementar el negocio  y  apoyar a los hijos en el estudio.  


El desafío que enfrenta es   mejorar la estabilidad económica.  



En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar caminatas familiares.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old. She is single and has a child. She lives in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province. 



Silvia works trading animals such as pigs. 



She is applying for the loan in order to increase the number of animals in her business and to be able to buy in cash.



She will make the purchases in the city of Santa Rita at the start of June. 



Her dream is to expand her business and support her children in their studies. 
 


The challenge she faces is to improve her economic stability. 



In her free time she likes to go on hikes with her family.

loans.use: to increase the number of animals in her business and to be able to buy in cash.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran, age 45, is a trader in fruits and vegetables. He buys fruits and vegetables from villages in the Tavush region and sells these in his rented stall at the Ijevan food market. Specifically, Seyran sells onions, cabbage, carrots, potatoes, citrus fruits, and greens, all of which he transports via his own car. 

Seyran is the only breadwinner in his family, and the profit from his trading business allows him to meet his family needs. He lives with his wife and their son and daughter in Ijevan city. 

For a long time, Seyran used to work as an auto repairman in the Tavush region, but after the collapse of the Soviet Union, he worked in the Russian Federation and supported his family from abroad. About a year ago, Seyran returned to his motherland and started his own trading business.
 
Seyran is requesting 300,000 Armenian drams from Kiva lenders in order to expand his offerings to include large quantities of tropical fruits, citrus fruits, apples, pears, and bananas.

loans.use: to expand his offerings to include tropical fruits, citrus fruits, apples, pears, and bananas

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana, age 52, runs a sari-sari (general store) business in the village of Sto. Niňo, Angadanan. She and her husband have seven children, and Cipriana works hard to help support and raise them. She has operated her business for three years. She usually receives a net income of PhP 300 a day. 

Cipriana is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, curls, bread, and beverages to offer for sale. She hopes to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, curls, bread, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a married man. He has 3 children ranging in age from 6 months to 10 years old. He describes himself as a visionary. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an urban area where there are many customers; his primary customers are area residents. He describes his biggest business challenges as insufficient funds and few customers during the rainy season. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad  es casada tiene dos hijos vive con su esposo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia 

Bolívar.



María se dedica a la agricultura como a la siembra de  mora.  



Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder dar mantenimiento al cultivo.
   


Las compras lo realiza en la Ciudad de  Chillanes cada fin de semana.   



Su sueño es dar mayor educación a sus hijos.  El desafío que enfrenta es el mal tiempo.   



En el tiempo libre le gusta cocer y escuchar noticias.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar Province. María works in agriculture, planting crops such as blackberries. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies so she can carry out maintenance on her crops. 

She makes her purchases in the city of Chillanes every weekend. Her dream is to give her children a better education. A challenge she faces is bad weather. In her free time, she likes to sew and to listen to the news.

loans.use: to buy supplies to carry out maintenance on her crops.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 52 years old and a housewife. She lives with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2002, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. Due to their large family size and low monthly income, they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business, so Nargis has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in her husband’s shop.

With the loan money, her husband will be able to buy a variety of goods for his general store, such as rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk, and utility items. This will satisfy his clients more professionally as well as increase his savings to provide a better future for their children. The profit would be used to expand the business and pay for their household expenses.

Nargis and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her husband's general store, such as rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk, and utility items

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, age 54, is a farmer. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and son in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and because there is always a high demand for fresh crops. People use fresh vegetables every day and include them in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family table in Azerbaijan and are often made into fresh punch.  

Rashid sells his crops in the BIlasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise his crops. Rashid also receives a pension.

As his products are in high demand, Rashid wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN. He will buy seeds and fertilizers with his loan funds. This will be his fifth loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yasmeen Group

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 33-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and nine children. Since 1998, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. Yasmeen, as a member of a two-person borrowing group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband will be able to buy a variety of fresh vegetables, enabling him to offer more variety to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó con la venta de encebollado solo a referidos y se dio cuenta que le resultaba el negocio, poco a poco puso el puesto en la esquina de su casa ya que la gente que vive por el sector lo conoce. 

Su dificultad es cuando sufre recaídas, no puede cocinar y tiene que pagarle a otra persona para que le cocine ya que el es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida). No es casado, ni tiene hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima pescados, yuca para el encebollado y sacar permiso municipal para poder tener el lugar donde vende encebollado establecido. Su sueño es tener una cadena de locales para vender comida y tener una casa un vehículo  y una familia con quien compartirlo.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He started out selling “encebollado” (a traditional breakfast dish that is made with fish and cassava) only to customers referred to him.  Then he realized that the business worked for him.  Little by little, he put up a stand on the corner of his house because the people living in the area know him.

The difficulty is when he suffers from relapses.  He is not then able to cook, and he has to pay another person to cook for him because his is a PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).  He is not married, nor does he have children.

He wants to use the loan to buy raw materials, fish, and cassava for the encebollado.  He will also use the loan to take out a municipal permit to be able to have an established place to sell encebollado.

His dream is to have a chain of places to sell food.  He dreams of having a house, a vehicle, and a family to share them with.

loans.use: to buy fish, cassava, and a municipal permit.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina nació en la comunidad de Mika y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. 

Martina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora telares, ella lleva a vender sus productos a la ciudad de Chichero pero también se dedica a la agricultura y venta de comida, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz, cebada, habas  y otras cosas más.  
   
Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y amable. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martina was born in the community of Mika, and she lives in the same community where she was born. (The community of Mika is located in the district of Colquepata, within the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru.) She is 50 years old, and she is married with five children. 

Martina is an enterprising and hard-working woman who works as an artisan. She has a small workshop in her home where she creates weavings. She takes her products to the city of Chichero to sell. However, she also works in agriculture and sells food. She has various plots of land under cultivation where she grows potatoes, corn, barley, beans and other crops. 

A group of women in her neighborhood invited her to participate in the “Intipakareq” communal bank because she is a responsible and agreeable person. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and soil amendments. She is grateful to everyone for the loan, and she is committed to making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and soil amendments.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, age 54, runs a general store business. She has been running her business for the past year. She earns additional income from food vending. She and her husband have seven children, and she works hard to help support her family.

Rosa has borrowed and paid three previous loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a PhP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more stocks to sell in her store, such as spices, soft drinks, sugar, and milk. 

Rosa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as spices, soft drinks, sugar, and milk to sell in her store

loans.name: Darwin Eduardo

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 23 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes    Provincia Bolívar. 


 
Darwin s dedica a al comercio de grano. 



Solicita el crédito para  capital de trabajo y poder incrementar el negocio.  


Las compras lo realizan  en la   comunidad de torreloma y los comercializa en  el mercado de  Santa Rita.



Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y darles un apoyo  económico a sus padres.  



El desafío que enfrenta es mejorar su estabilidad económica con el incremento del negocio.  


En su tiempo libre le gusta realizar deporte como jugar indor y bolí.
texts.en:
Darwin is 23 years old. He is single and he lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolívar province. Darwin sells grain. He is asking for the loan for working capital and to be able to increase his business. The purchases are made in the community of Torreloma, and Darwin sells them in the market of Santa Rita.

Darwin's dream is to improve his business and give his parents economic support. The challenge that he faces is improving his economic stability with the growth of the business.

In his free time, Darwin likes to do sports like indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: obtain working capital to be able to grow his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chairs and hair dryers

loans.name: Husan

texts.en:
Husan, age 47, is a cattle breeder. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and five children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and earns an income by selling milk and milk products, as well as selling cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Rashid has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who expertly taught him how to look after cattle.

Husan usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them at a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. He also sells milk and yogurt to his neighbors. Milk and meat sales bring him an income of 100 AZN per month. Milk, yogurt, and meat are all very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in such everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma, and most people usually serve yogurt sauce with their meals. Milk products are considered very healthy and are consumed daily.

This is the only source of financial income for the family, and Husan reports that it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. He has therefore applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN in order to purchase two milk cows, two cattle, and cattle fodder. He has already completed several loans with AqroInvest and has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows, two cattle, and cattle fodder

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Rómulo nació en la comunidad de Mika y vive  en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 36 años de edad, es casado por este lazo matrimonial tiene seis hijos. 

Rómulo es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes, a la agricultura, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía y la crianza de animales menores, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rómulo was born in the community of Mika and lives in the same community in which he was born. (The community of Mika is located in the Colquepata  administrative division of in the Paucartambo province, in the region of Cusco, Perú). He is 36 and married. Through this marriage, he has six children. 

Rómulo is an entrepreneurial and hard-working father who makes a living offering transport services, doing agriculture, fattening cattle, doing craftwork, raising small animals, as well as having several plots of crop land where he sows potatoes, barley, corn, oca (a type of tuber), and other things.

A group of neighbors invited him to participate in the communal bank "Intipakareq” because he is a responsible and joyful person. At this time, he requires a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds. He is thankful to everyone for the loan and is committed to punctually making his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.en:
With 50 years of experience as a photographer, Rigoberto has decades of knowledge of how to manipulate light and lenses to make a photo special and unique. 

“In the art world there is the Avant-Garde and that is what I do:  progressive, modern type of photography,” Rigoberto said. “I don’t just point and shoot.  I do creative imagery at the beginning of the process, in the middle and at the end to create a unique image. I don’t do snapshots. It is a process that elaborates through the concept of the image until it is done.”
