Though Rigoberto is well-known in art circles in El Paso, he established a commercial photography business in 2006 and has been working to build his business. Before coming to Accion Texas, he said what he didn’t have was the working capital he needed to buy material for framing, for supplies and other items he needed to further promote his business.

“The loan has been essential for my supplies and materials, to be able to go places and offer my services and products,” Rigoberto said. “I am better able to expand my way of advertising my products personally.” In addition to buying glass and wood to make frames, he is planning on buying software and internet services to create an online portfolio of his work. 

Currently, Rigoberto is a one-man business, but he hopes to grow enough so he can hire a manager.  He said one of his goals is to pay back the Accion Texas working capital loan and come back to apply for a larger loan so he can buy new equipment and hire a manager.

“At the moment I am just grateful,” he said. “I am excited to have received this opportunity to proceed with my objective of establishing a stronger presence.”

loans.use: to purchase glass and wood to create frames and market his company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover rent costs, market her business and pay workers.

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elicita, age 36, is a farmer. She has been farming vegetables for 11 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF (and more recently from Kiva) to sustain her business. She and her husband have four children.

Elicita has requested a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.
 
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, undergarments, socks, and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria nació en la comunidad de Cotañi y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Cotañi está localizada en el distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene siete hijos. 

Maria es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas y otras cosas más pero también se dedica a la fabricación de telares.  
  
Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y amable. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como lana de alpaca y oveja. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the community of Cotañi and lives in the same community she was born in. (The community of Cotañi is located in the Huancarani administrative division in the Paucartambo province of the region of Cusco, Peru). She is 35 years old, married, and has seven children.

Maria is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman who makes a living doing crafts. She has a small workshop in her home where she weaves products such as sweaters, scarves, and other things but she also works to produce looms.

A group of neighbors invited her to participate in the communal bank “Intipakareq” because she is a very responsible and friendly person. At this time, she requires a loan in order to buy work materials such as alpaca and sheep wool. She is grateful to everyone for the loan, and is committed to making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy work material such as alpaca and sheep wool

loans.name: Gladys Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita  tiene 27 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo vive con sus padres en el  Cantón Chillanes 

Provincia Bolívar.




Margarita se dedica al comercio de granos. 



Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos para y poder  ampliar el negocio. 



La compra lo realiza  en Chillanes. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda.  





El desafío que enfrenta es   el capital para poder trabajar.  



En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Margarita is 27, single, has one son and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar Province. Margarita makes a living selling grains. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of grains in order to expand her business. She will make her purchase in Chillanes. 

Her dream is to have her own home. The challenge she faces is a lack of capital in order to work. In her free time she likes to do sports and watch television.

loans.use: to buy grains in order to expand her business

loans.name: Milton Alberto

texts.es: Milton de 39 años de edad, es un hombre soñador y apasionado, asegura que uno de sus más grandes placeres es estudiar cocina, ya que considera que tiene habilidades para la preparación de buenos alimentos. Razón que lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito con el fin de capacitarse en la preparación de carnes frías y embutidos, con la convicción de montar su negocio en un futuro próximo y generar los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Milton is 39 years old. He is a dreamer and a passionate man. Milton says that one of his greatest pleasures is studying cooking as he believes he already has skills for the preparation of good food. 

The reason that has prompted him to ask for a loan is to get training in the preparation of deli meats and sausages with the certainty of setting up shop in the near future and to generate sufficient resources to sustain his family.

loans.use: to be trained in the preparation of deli meats.

loans.name: Manash

texts.en:
Manash is a 19-year-old physically challenged person living with his family in a small village in Odisha, India. His family consists of his parents and his one brother, age 16. His father is a farmer and his brother is continuing his schooling. Manash has a general store at the village market, which is one kilometer from his home and he is earning 3,000 INR from his general store. To help his family, he started the general store in the market. Whatever he earns from this activity is used for consumption purposes and is not sufficient for his family to live happily and afford all the necessities of life.

He sells packaged items like biscuits, cake, wafers, chocolates, cosmetic items, face creams, hair oils, shampoos, body talc, body deodorants, body lotions and fashion accessories (earrings, finger rings, bangles, bracelets, bangles etc.) in his general store. He goes to market to purchase the items for his store very frequently. But due to lack of funds, he is not able to meet the growing demand of the customers and compete with his competitors.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase stock of what he sells in bulk and to purchase fashion accessories (earrings, finger rings, bangles, bracelets, bangles etc) and bakery items for his store so that he can reach the market demand and compete with his competitor. He hopes to enlarge his business and construct a concrete house for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fashion accessories (earrings, finger rings, bangles, bracelets, bangles, etc) and bakery items to sell

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres de escasos recursos que quieren mejorar sus vidas y las de sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Son mujeres jefas de familia que deciden tomar las riendas en sus manos y trabajar para salir adelante.
Elizabeth trabaja en la venta de productos de limpieza que les provee la fundación paraguaya por medio de microfranquicias. Ella tiene muy buena clientela  que siempre le hace muchos pedidos. Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por su familia y por darle todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de microfranquicia de limpieza, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas y darle a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group are women of limited resources. They want to improve their lives and those of their families through their work. The members are female heads of household who have decided to take control of the reins and work in order to get ahead.

Elizabeth works by selling cleaning products provided by Fundación Paraguaya through a microfranchise. She has a good clientele and always receives many orders. Elizabeth is a hardworking individual who strives on behalf of her family so that she can provide everything they need.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a cleaning products microfranchise. This will allow her to continue her sales and provide her customers with what they request.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning products microfranchise.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil, age 30, is a cattle breeder. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) living with his wife and son in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Habil breeds cows and cattle, and he sells milk and milk products as well as selling cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Habil has five years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who expertly taught him how to look after cattle. 

Habil usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them at a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He also sells milk and yogurt to his neighbors. Milk and meat sales bring him 100 AZN income per month. Milk and yogurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in such everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always accompany these with yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are consumed daily.   

This is the only source of financial income for the family, and Habil reports that it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his famaily. Habil has therefore applied for a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN in order to purchase two cattle, two milk cows, and cattle fodder. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle, two milk cows, and cattle fodder

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma runs a general store to earn a living. She earns additional income from operating a motorcycle transport. She and her husband have four children, and Vilma works hard to help support her family. Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.
 
Vilma is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional stocks to sell in her store, such as soap, coffee, can goods, sugar, and spices.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, coffee, can goods, sugar, and spices to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosana Maruxi

texts.es:
Rosana tiene 26 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo vive con la familia en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia 

Bolívar.



Rosana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno.  


Solicita   el crédito para incrementar el ganado  y poder comprar al contado. 
 


Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de  Chillanes en el mercado Santa Rita.  



Su sueño es mejorar su estabilidad económica.  


El desafío que  enfrenta es mejorar  crecer  el mercado de ganado vacuno.  



En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar deporte.
texts.en:
Rosana is 26 years old. She is single, has one son, and lives with her family in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolivar province. Rosana raises livestock. 

She is asking for a loan to increase the number of cattle and to be able to buy them with cash. The purchases are made in the city of Chillanes in the market of Santa Rita. 

Rosana's dream is to improve her economic stability. 

The challenge she faces is to improve the growth of the cattle market. 

In her free time, Rosana likes to do sports.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle and to be able to purchase them with cash.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 60 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 03 hijos que ya son independientes,  tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su esposo.Ana se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su bodega la cual está instalada en su propia casa, siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, a todos atiende con amabilidad,  su bodega lleva ya 04  años de funcionamiento tiempo en el cual a llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo en ocasiones de su esposo para la atención al público.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos a quienes les da una buena atención.Este será su préstamo numero 03 con Kiva y  está muy agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad y el apoyo que le brinda.Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos  soles comprará productos comestibles en general  para  surtir su bodega tales como  arroz, azúcar, harina, etc para obtener mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Ana, age 60, is married and has three children who are now adults.  She has her own house, which she bought with her husband’s support.

Ana sells food in her store, which is set up in her own house.  It is very popular with the neighbors and the outsiders who pass through the area.  She tends to all of them with kindness.  She has had the store for four years, and during that time she has come to be very well known and popular.  Her husband helps wait on the public her on occasion.

What she likes about her work is that it made her very well-known in the area.  Most of her customers are her neighbors, and she gives them good service.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity and the support given to her.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy general food products to stock her store.  She will buy things like rice, sugar, and flour, etc. in order to get better results.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, and flour, among others.

loans.name: Menakarani

texts.en:
Menakarani is a 35-year-old woman living with her parents-in-law, her one daughter and her one son who are four and two years old, respectively, in a small village of Odisha. Three years back, unfortunately, her husband passed away from an unknown disease. Since then, to manage her family she started a grocery store at her home where 100 families depend on her grocery store. In this way, she is earning 3,500 INR per month. She has kept grocery items like rice, lentils, cooking oil, salt, sugar, spices, noodles, potatoes, onions etc. in her grocery store. She purchases these items in small amounts not in bulk because she lacks funds. So she cannot meet the growing customers' demands. 

As a woman, it is difficult to go to the market very frequently and she is not able to make her products available when her customers need them. She wants to purchase these grocery items in bulk and set up shelves in her grocery store. So that she can meet the present growing customers' demands for grocery items, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase the above grocery items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, cooking oil, salt, sugar, spices, noodles, potatoes, onion, etc. in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 59, owns and operates a cocoa farm in his local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns PhP 8,000 per month. She and her husband have three children and live in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Erlinda has joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services. Her goal is to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. 

She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizer, such as manure, to use in her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, to use in her farm

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: This time, Carmen is borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to fund her general store business. Her business was previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva partner, who continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narayan

texts.en:
Narayan is a 25-year-old physically challenged person living with his family in a small village of Odisha, India. His family consists of his wife and his one daughter, age three. His wife is a homemaker. He is the only earning person in his family. To manage his family, he started a general store at the village market, which is a half kilometer from his home. Whatever he earns from this activity is used for consumption purpose and is not sufficient for them to live happily and afford all necessities of life.

He sells packaged items like biscuits, cake, wafers, chocolates, betel etc. in his shop. He goes to market to purchase the items for his shop very frequently. But due to the lack of funds, he is not able to meet the growing demand of the customers and compete with his competitors.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase stock of what he sells in bulk and to purchase grocery items like rice, lentils, cooking oil, salt, sugar, spices and noodles etc. for his general store so that he can meet the market demand and compete with his competitor. He hopes to enlarge his business and provide good education to his daughter.

loans.use: to pay for rice, lentils, cooking oil, salt, sugar, spices and noodles etc.for his general store

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y asimismo se dedica también a la crianza de ganado. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo y sus dos hijos de edades de 5 y 8 años, cuatro personas son las que dependen de María; el oficio lo realiza con su familia y lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 9:00pm con la ventaja que es en su casa.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar ganado; esta inversión le ayudara a poder obtener mejores ganancias, ya que después de darle pasto al ganado esto lo venderá, así podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su seres queridos.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio de la tienda y realizar algunas modificaciones a la vivienda.
texts.en:
María has a store selling convenience store products and also makes a living raising cattle. She lives with her family, her husband and her two children, ages five and eight. Four people depend on María. 

She does her job alongside her family, carrying out her work from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, with the advantage of it being in her home.

The loan she requires will allow her to buy cattle: This investment will help her be able to obtain better returns. After grazing the cattle she will sell them, and that way she will be able to offer her loved ones a better quality of life. 

Her dream is to grow the store's business and make some modifications to her home.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 35, grows and sells vegetables to earn an income. She earns about PhP 500 each week through this business. Edna and her husband have four children and live in a village in Angadanan, Isabela, Philippines.

Edna's goal is to earn more income so that she can sufficiently provide for her family's needs and to save for the future of her children. 

At this time, she has planted more vegetables and is expecting to increase her production next season. However, due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. 

The loan will help her increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Shazia Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 37-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and one daughter. All of her children are currently studying in primary school. Shazia’s husband is a labourer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Shazia is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 3 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Shazia, as a member of three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future and her production can be increased. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to expand her business and provide quality education to her children. With the profits she will pay her house rent. 

Shazia and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
Melenia operates a business selling used clothing to earn an income. She earns additional income by raising pigs. She and her husband have seven children, and she works hard to help support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Melenia is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., in order to purchase more used clothing items to sell to her customers.

Melenia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of summer clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Fathia

texts.en:
Fathia, age 51, is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured inside the family's new house. 

Fathia and her husband have one son and a daughter. Her husband and son are employed as workers, but their salaries are low and barely cover the family's necessities. They are unable to afford to finish the new house they have recently built for the family.
 
Fathia is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. She will use her loan funds to help cover the cost of installing tiles and painting their new house. This loan will thus allow Fathia and her family to enjoy better living conditions in their new house.

loans.use: to finish construction of the family house

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 32 years old and married with two children.

Rodelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rodelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer, as well as feed for her pigs.

Rodelyn has been farming vegetables for four years now. She has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia sells salt and fermented fish to earn an income. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has successfully repaid her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business. 

Patricia is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more stocks of salt and fermented fish to sell to her customers.

NWTF is re-listing Patricia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase salt and fermented fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man and a father to two sons and one daughter. He is employed and gets a small salary which is not enough to cover the family's costs of living.

For the past five years, Mohammad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support from time to time to cover some urgent costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing and insuring the taxi he drives. This will enable Mohammad to move freely from one area to another and take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Mohammad is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the cost of licensing and insuring the taxi

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Abdel Kareem appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture taken in his store.

Wisam is a 20-year-old married young woman with no children yet. For the past two years, Wisam's husband has been working in clothing sales.  He has a store selling different types of men clothes.  His store is located in a good commercial area and has many loyal customers because he brings in a good quality of men clothes.  This makes his project a profitable one and the only source of income to the family, but also from time to time it needs more support to cover the cost.

Wisam is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of men clothes to sell. This will allow Wisam's husband to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new collection of men clothes to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza, de 37 años de edad, esta divorciada pero vive con su hijo de 10 años de edad en la casa sus padres junto a sus hermanos.El trabajo que realiza Eliza, es la compra y venta de diversos artículos de uso del hogar y artículos personales como ropas y zapatos para damas y caballeros de diversos modelos y tallas. Los productos que mayor preferencia tienen entre sus clientes son aquellos que se usan en la cocina como ollas, utensilios de mesa, sartenes, baldes entre otros. También ofrece accesorios para los niños de la casa como juguetes didácticos que contribuyen al desarrollo de su inteligencia. Ha instalado su negocio en al casa de su padre. Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 09 años, antes trabajaba sola pero ahora lo hace con la ayuda de su madre. Su horario de atención es desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y gracias a su trabajo a salido de muchos apuros económicos.Este es el préstamo número 06 con Kiva,agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir aumentando su negocio y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de  S/.2500 soles, comprará bandejas, platos , ollas y artículos de cocina, entre otros para continuar vendiendo en su negocio para ésta temporada.
texts.en:
Eliza is 37 years old and is divorced, but she lives with her 10 year old son in the home of her parents together with her siblings. Eliza's work consists of the purchase and sale of various household items and personal items like clothing, and various sizes and models of shoes for women and men. The products that are highly preferred by her customers are those that are used in the kitchen like pots, silverware, trays, and buckets, among others. She also offers merchandise for young children like learning games that contribute to the development of their intelligence. She has established her business in the home of her father. She has worked in this location for 9 years. Previously, she worked alone, but now she works with the help of her mother. Her business hours are from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. She feels content that the business has brought her a lot of satisfaction and thanks to her work she has escaped many economic hardships. This is her sixth loan with Kiva. She is grateful to those who are offering the loan that she needs to continue growing her business and she promises to make her payments on time. 

With the amount she is seeking of $975 she will buy pans, plates, pots and items for the kitchen, among others, to continue selling via her business this season.

loans.use: to buy pots, pans and trays, among other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest and self-driven. She operates a food stall where she sells cooking fat, maize flour, and other food stuffs. Her business is located in an urban area where there are many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expansion. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy stock of cooking fat, maize flour, and wheat flour. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful and educate her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of cooking fat, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ma.wilma

texts.en: This time, Maria Wilma is applying for a new loan of 29,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Her business was previously funded through Kiva and NWTF in order to continue to provide for her and her family with an income that improves their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer, who appears in the picture, is a 24-year-old single young man. He is a worker and earns a small salary which is barely enough to cover his cost of living.

Sameer is building his new house, and he still needs more support to finish, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth Loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing bricks and cement.

Taking this loan will make Sameer feel happy to complete building his new house so he can enjoy living in his house.

loans.use: to complete building his house by purchasing bricks and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries and to make improvements to the store

loans.name: Nael

texts.en:
Nael, age 30 and unmarried, works in a bakery. At present he earns a very low salary that is not enough to cover his cost of living.

Nael is pictured in his new house. He wants to prepare his new house so that he will be able to get married. He is therefore requesting a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN, which will cover the cost of installing tiles and painting the house.

Receiving this loan will enable Nael to complete his house, which will then cause him to be able to offer suitable home conditions to a prospective bride. He hopes to marry soon and looks forward to living with his wife in his new and finished house.

loans.use: to install tiles and paint his house in preparation for getting married

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle repair kit

loans.name: Shifaa

texts.en:
Shifaa, age 50, is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured inside the family's new house.

Shifaa and her husband have four sons and six daughters. Her husband is a construction worker and so are some of her sons.

Shifaa is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN in order to cover the cost of painting the house and installing new windows and doors. Receiving this loan will speed the process of completing the house. This will offer Shifaa and her family suitable house conditions. 

She hopes that the family can enjoy living in their new, finished house soon.

loans.use: to complete work on the family house

loans.name: Fredy

texts.en:
Fredy, age 40, grows and sells vegetables to earn a living. He earns approximately PhP 500 each week from this business. He lives with his wife and child in a village in Angadanan, Isabela.

Fredy aims to earn more income in order to better provide for his family's needs, as well as to save for the future of his child. At this time, he has planted more vegetables, expecting to increase his production next season. However, due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his vegetable production. 

He is confident that the loan funds will help him increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his vegetable production

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, age 35, raises pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for six years now. She has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF (and, more recently, from Kiva) to sustain it. She and her husband have five children, one of whom is enrolled in school.

Analyn has requested a PhP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Un Nuevo Resplandor Group

texts.es: Marcela tiene 40 años de edad ella es originaria de una comunidad indígena otomí, un lugar lleno de vegetación y donde la principal fuente de empleo es la elaboración de costuras y cría y venta de borregos. Ella es parte de un grupo llamado Un Nuevo Resplandor y la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican hacer costuras para vender. Marcela esta asociada con otras señoras las cuales hacen pasteles, galletas, gelatinas, pay de queso y diferentes postres  para vender dice que tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 4 años y dice que le va bien en las ventas ya que hacen pedidos para eventos especiales y  que son pasteles caseros y eso le gusta más a los clientes. También en sus tiempos libres hace costuras como servilletas, almohadones, manteles para vender, dice que en el local donde tienen los postres ahí también aprovecha para vender sus costuras y que si ha tenido buenas ventas, ella está pidiendo un crédito para mejorar sus negocios y comprar material e insumos para hacer sus postres como cuadrille, tela, hilos, marquice, agujas, estambres, aros y para los postres, diferentes tipos de leche, harina, huevo, saborizantes, frutas etc. Dice que si le hacen el crédito su negocio mejorara y así podrá sacar ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos en la escuela y a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Feliciana, Arnulfa y Pilar ellas invertirán en sus negocios de en la compra de abonos, fertilizantes para cultivo de aguacate, para la compra de material para hacer bordados artesanales, para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla de maíz para vender.
texts.en: Marcela is 40 years old and she is originally from the indigenous community of otomí, a place full of vegetation where being a seamstress or a lamb farmer are the primary types of employment. She is a member of a group called "A New Glow" and the majority of the members sew crafts to sell. Marcela is associated with other women who make cakes, cookies, puddings, cheesecake and different desserts to sell. She says that she has worked with this business for approximately 4 years and she said that the sales are going well now that they take orders for special events and the cakes are homemade which the customers greatly prefer. In her free time she also makes textiles including napkins, pillows and tablecloths to sell. She says that in the place where they make the desserts she can also sell her textiles and that she achieves good sales. She is seeking a loan to improve her businesses and to buy materials and supplies for her sewing and her desserts like checkered cloth, fabrics, threads, needles, yarns and rings and for the desserts, chocolate mousse, different types of milk, flour, eggs, flavorings, and fruit, etc. She says that if she receives the loan her business will improve and she will be able to obtain earnings to support her children in school and to assist her husband with the expenses of their home. The other three members of the group are named Feliciana, Arnulfa and Pilar. They will invest in their businesses through the purchase of fertilizers, nutrients for growing avocados, and corn seeds to sell and the purchase of materials for handmade embroidery.

loans.use:
to buy materials for handmade embroidery and the creation of desserts to sell, such as 
fabrics, thread and needles, etc. and chocolate mousse, milk, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sumaq Tikari Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Sumaq Tikari” del distrito de Paucartambo de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican al agricultura, venta de comida, ganadería, artesanía, crianza de animales menores y otros. 

Hilda está levantando la mano en la fotografía, ella nació en la comunidad de Kallacancha pero vive en la comunidad de Chimbamba a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona responsable y amable pues sus vecinos no dudaron en invitar a participar en el banco comunal, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de elaboración de artesanía de tipo tejido pero también se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como lana de alpaca y oveja para poder elaborar chompas, mantas, pasadizos, chullos, chalinas y otros cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank “Sumaq Tikari”  in the district of Paucartambo, in the province Paucartambo, in the state of Cusco. This communal bank is made up of various people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead and to use their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children. The members work in agriculture, selling food, livestock, arts and crafts and the raising of young animals, among others.

Hilda is raising her hand in the photo. She was born in the community of Kallacancha, but she lives in the community of Chimbamba, 40 minutes from the city of Paucartambo. She is a responsible and friendly person and her neighbors did not hesitate to invite her to participate in the comunal bank. She has a small business making arts and crafts from fabric, but she also works in agriculture and raises young animals. In response to this opportunity she is requesting the loan to buy materials for her work like wool from alpaca and sheep to be able to make sweaters, blankets, belts, hats, scarves and other things.

The members are generally grateful for the opportunity they've been given and agree to comply with the established payment deadlines.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work, like wool from alpaca and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his new business

loans.name: Saiid

texts.en:
Saiid is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children. Over the years, he has made a good experience working as a painter. He works in his town, sticking with multiple projects, and also works upon customers’ requests. He is seeking to offer his family a respectable way of living, since he’s their only source of income. 

Today, Saiid is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renew his business tools and improve his business. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the clients and make a good business reputation. 

In the future, he hopes to take multiple construction projects in order to further expand his business operations.

loans.use: to renew his business tools and improve his business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and married with two children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Elsa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: El Centro De San Felipe Group

texts.es:
San Felipe de Alzati es una comunidad indígena donde la mayoría de las personas se dedica al cultivo de flores de Nochebuena, se dice que San Felipe es el primer productor de noche buena del país y que año con año produce más de 8 millones de flores en diferentes especies y da 2500 empleos directos. 
Dice don Lamberto que estan orgullosos de pertenecer a este pueblo ya que dice él “en mi pueblo somos gente trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante” el tiene una carnicería en el centro de su población con la cual lleva 17 años trabajando en su negocio, dice que puso su negocio para sacar a su familia adelante el tiene dos hijos uno de ellos estudia la preparatoria y el otro tiene 3 años y todavía no va a la escuela. 
El cría reces y cerdos para después venderlos por kilos en su carnicería, dice que le gusta mucho lo que hace porque está al pendiente de su negocio y de sus animales, platica que abre su changarro desde las ocho de la mañana y cierra a las seis de la tarde ya que casi todo el día le van a comprar carne, también vende longaniza ya que su esposa la hace, el está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de unas reces para criarlas y venderlas en su carnicería, dice que él está muy contento de trabajar con Visión Fund porque no se la ha hecho pesado y a podido pagar en forma y tiempo sus créditos. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Adriana, Adalberto, Lorena y Noema ellos van a invertir en sus negocios de para la compra de calzado y ropa por catalogo para su venta, compra, cría y venta de cerdos, para la compra de pollo para su venta por kilos.
texts.en: San Felipe de Alzati is an indigenous community where most of the people work growing poinsettias. It is said that San Felipe is the number one producer of poinsettias in the country. Year after year, it produces more than 8 million flowers of different varieties and it provides 2,500 direct jobs. Lamberto says that they are proud to belong to this village, because he says, "In my village we are hard-working people with a great desire to move forward." He has a butcher shop in the middle of his town. He has 17 years of experience in his business. He says that he started his business to advance his family. He has two children. One of them is in prep school and the other is three years old and doesn't go to school yet. He raises cattle and pigs to later sell by the kilo in his butcher shop. He says that he really likes what he does because he is very attentive to his business and to his animals. He says that he opens his shop starting at 8 in the morning and he closes it at six in the evening, because people come to buy meat almost all day. He also sells sausage that his wife makes. He is asking for a loan to buy some cattle to raise and later sell in his butcher shop. He says that he is very happy to work with Vision Fund, because it has not been difficult and he has been able to make his payments on time. The other groups members are Adriana, Adalberto, Lorena, and Noema. They are going to invest in their businesses, which are: buying footwear and clothing through a catalogue in order to sell them; buying, raising, and selling pigs; and buying chicken to sell by the kilo.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell their meat by the kilo.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a Lebanese married man. He’s 47 years old. He’s married to Khadija, the mother of his three school-aged children.  Cooperating together, Youssef and his wife were able to cover their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his business in 2007. He owns a car assistance service. His job consists of transporting cars to the garage in the case of damages. He’s punctual and has customers from all over the neighboring areas. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase new wheels for his vehicle and perform the needed maintenance on it in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more and added customers. In the future, he plans to collect a fair amount of money and better develop his family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase new wheels for his vehicle and perform the needed maintenance on it

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 33 years old, married and is blessed with three children. She sells frozen foods in her village to help her husband make money. She walks house to house in her village to sell her products.

Marina would like to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason she is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan though ASKI to buy more hot dogs, tocino (a type of bacon), ham and longaniza (pork sausages) to sell.

Being an industrious mother, Marina believes that she can improve her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 58-year-old married woman with five children. She has been selling cereals for 17 years, and she earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be Elizabeth’s third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more assorted cereals like dry maize and beans to sell. She hopes to grow her business and to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more assorted cereals like dry maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
San Judas es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 personas muy amables, alegres y luchadoras que tienen sus propios negocios y tienen un objetivo en común que es brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. 
este grupo se encuentra ubicada en Tierra Blanca, Veracruz donde las principales actividades económicas son el comercio y la ganadería. Quienes integran este grupo y sus actividades son: Luis Yovany venta de calzado, Nicolasa venta de tacos, Flora venta de antojitos, Miriam venta de cosméticos, Ligia venta de bolsas de mano, Melvi Anahi venta de cosméticos, Silvia venta de productos naturistas, Abraham carnicería.


Flora tiene la edad de 50 años,estudio la secundaria y es soltera, ella nos platica que por mas de 4 años se ha dedicado a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, ella inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que quería trabajar para salir adelante y como sebe cocinar rico pensó en iniciar a vender antojitos e inicio a caminar bien su negocio hasta el día de hoy continua con su venta, ella realiza sus ventas desde su hogar los fines de semana(viernes, sábado, y domingo) por las noches, también en otras ocasiones vende comidas corridas y se gana un dinero extra. "a mi me gusta andar movida, no debes estar atenido a lo que tienes, hay que buscarle porque el dinero no llega solo".

Un crédito de vision Fun le ayudara a comprar tortillas, frijol, carne, chiles, aguacate, queso, crema, tomates, cebolla, aceite, frijol, papas, plátanos, maíz, gas y refrescos para la elaboración de su venta.

Ella quiere que su negocio continué creciendo y ganar mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten. 

Este grupo agradece el apoyo que se les brinda con estos prestamos.
texts.en:
San Judas is the name of this group, made up of eight very friendly, joyful, and determined people who have their own businesses and a common goal: to give their families a better quality of life. This group is located in Tierra Blanca, Veracruz, where the main economic activities are trade and ranching. The members of this group and their businesses are as follows: Luiz Yovany sells footwear, Nicolasa sells tacos, Flora sells food, Miriam sells cosmetics, Ligia sells handbags, Melvi Anahi sells cosmetics, Silvia sells natural products, and Abraham sells meat.

Flora, 50, studied through secondary school and is single. She tells us that she has worked selling Mexican corn-based dishes for more than four years. She started working in her own business because she wanted to work to move forward. Since she knows how to cook well, she decided to start selling food and her business took off. Today, she continues with her business. She sells from her home on weekends (Friday, Saturday, Sunday) in the evening. Sometimes she sells food on other occasions and earns some extra money. "I like to be on the move. You shouldn't cling to what you have. You must search for it because money doesn't come in on its own." A loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy tortillas, beans, meat, peppers, avocado, cheese, cream, tomatoes, onions, oil, potatoes, bananas, corn, gas, and soft drinks to make what she sells. She wants her business to keep growing and gain more customers so that her profits increase. 

This group is thankful for the help provided by these loans.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, meat, peppers, tomatoes, onion, oil, beans, potatoes, bananas, corn, gas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: El Fresno De La Soledad Group

texts.es:
Doña Francisca tiene 46 años edad, ella es una mujer trabajadora; le gusta la tierra en donde vive, es un lugar lleno de vegetación y con unas vistas hermosas. Le pusieron a su grupo el Fresno de la Soledad ya que donde se juntaban había un gran árbol de fresno y para ubicar rápido el grupo le pusieron así, dice que ahorita ella esta triste porque su suegro está muy enfermito y que el formaba parte del grupo que era un señor muy trabajador y ahorita lo tiene muy delicado de salud ya que ella lo cuida. 
Francisca se dedica al cultivo de aguacates, dinde vive tiene un gran terreno en el cual cultiva maíz, flores de cempasúchil, duraznos, rastrojo etc. Dice que el terreno lo tiene dividido en dos  partes en una parte tiene el huerto de aguacate y en el otro lado es donde siembra, ella está pidiendo un crédito por que quiere comprarle a sus árboles de aguacate abonos e insecticidas para reforzarlos ya que ahorita tienen el fruto pequeño y para que no se les caiga el fruto necesita ponerle los insumos, dice que tiene 180 árboles y entre su esposo y ella los cuidan ya  que es lo que de herencia le dejaran a sus hijos. 
Platica que Visión Fund le ha hecho varios créditos y que en todos ha pagado bien y que gracias a estos ella a podido hacer crecer su huerto, platica que con lo que le baya a dejar de ganancias sus aguacates ella piensa comprar una bomba con mas capacidad para regar sus árboles. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Rogelio, Juan y Luis Antonio ellos invertirán en la compra de artículos para surtir una tienda de abarrotes y para la compra de insumos para mejorar las condiciones de huertos de aguacate.
texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She likes the land where she lives; it is a place full of vegetation and beautiful views. They named their group "El Fresno de la Soledad" ["The Ash of Solitude"] because where they were meeting, there was a big ash tree, and to locate the group quickly, they gave it that name. She says that she is sad right now because her father-in-law is very ill. He was a member of the group and a very hardworking gentleman; now his health is very delicate, so she is taking care of him. 

Francisca earns her living growing avocados. Where she lives, she has a big field where she grows corn, marigolds, peaches, a stubble crop, etc. She says that she has the field divided in half; in one half she has the avocado orchard, and in the other half, she grows the other crops. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy fertilizers and insecticides to strengthen her avocado trees; she has small fruit right now, and to keep them from falling off, she needs to apply these materials. She says that she has 180 trees and she and her husband take care fo them because they hope to one day leave them to their children as an inheritance.

She says that Vision Fund has made several loans to her and that she has paid all of them back well, and that thanks to those loans, she has been able to make her farm grow. She says that with the profits that she will earn from her avocado crop, she is planning to buy a higher-capacity pump to water her trees. The other members fo the group are named Rogelio, Juan, and Luis Antonio. They will invest in the purchase of items to stock a grocery store and supplies to improve the conditions of avocado orchards.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing avocados, like fertilizers, lime, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has been a farmer for three years, and his farm is located in a productive area. He faces a challenge of lack of funds to run the farm. 

Benson plans to use the loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more chicks and to improve the family's living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is an honest man and sees himself being  a regional supplier of chicken.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks

loans.name: Concepta

texts.en:
Concepta is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as an honest person.

For the past ten years Concepta has run a food stall from which she sells sugar, cooking oil and other foods. Her stall is in an urban area where there are many customers, mostly nearby residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expansion.

Concepta’s previous loan with SMEP DTM was paid off successfully. She is now applying for a 45,000 KES loan to buy sugar, cooking oil and other food for her stall. Her goal is to significantly expand the business within five years and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and other food for her stall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a petty trader who deals in the sale of smoked fish and yams in Wegbe, Hohoe. Nancy has never received any formal education because her parent didn’t see a reason to send a girl child to school. She is married and has one child with her husband, who is into sand mining. Nancy has been selling smoked fish since six years ago. She assists her husband with the feeding of the family. Her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of fish and yams for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish and yams for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sugar, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nancy aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim is 26 years old and single. He lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over three years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Ma. Nesie

texts.en:
Ma. Nesie is 43 years old and married with 4 children.

Ma. Nesie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Ma. Nesie has been in this business for 17 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Cely

texts.en: Cely is 45 years old and married with two children. She is thankful because she was blessed with a productive business. She operates car services such as car washing and car painting as well as a sari-sari store. She gets all the expenses needed in their everyday living. That causes her to strive and work harder. She wants to acquire a good income everyday. Now, Cely is requesting additional capitalization to boost up her business. An amount of PHP 40,000 will be a great help in the purchase of car paint, car soap, and grocery items to stock her sari-sari store. She hopes for the approval of her loan requests in order to maximize her business and save for the educational purposes of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase car paint, car soap, and grocery items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and has four  children. Joyce is a provisions/mineral drinks seller at Wegbe, Hohoe, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a businessman. Joyce uses her income to give financial support to her husband. She will use the loan to purchase cartons of tinned tomatoes, milo, sugar, canned milk, and mineral drinks. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to save and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of tinned tomatoes, milo, sugar, canned milk, and mineral drinks.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is 63 years old and a mother of five children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 4,000.

Nzingo was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 to buy seeds, some fertilizer, and other farm inputs needed for her business. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for two of her grandchildren to expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for her business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un señor de 50 años quien tiene 12 hijos con su pareja y actualmente viven en Sololá.
El se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y lo realiza en el lugar de su vivienda. Eligio esta actividad por que puede trabajar a cualquier hora ya que mediante lo que labora, obtiene  ingresos  aceptables  y de esta manera  aporta a la economía familiar.  
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para capital de trabajo ya que necesita cultivar papa, y así  poder generar más ingresos.
Uno de sus sueños es sacar adelante a todos sus hijos en los estudios para  que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alberto, 50, has 12 children and currently lives in Sololá. He has worked in agriculture for 15 years and he does this work where he lives. He chose this activity because he can work at any time, since through his work, he has an acceptable income and supports his family. He is applying for a loan of 
Q 5,500 for working capital because he needs to grow potatoes. This way, he will be able to earn more income. One of his dreams is to advance all his children in their studies so that they have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to have working capital that he needs to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling up to the middle school level and couldn’t continue because her parents had no funds to send her to school. Hence, she decided to learn a trade. Domingo is a local seamstress in Wegbe, Hohoe Township, which she has done for the past 16 years. Her husband is an auto mechanic. 

Domingo uses her income to help her husband with providing other basic needs of the family and with the payment of their children's school fees. Domingo will use the loan to purchase more linen, zippers, and assorted buttons for her sewing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Domingo plans to save and acquire an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase to buy more linen, zippers, and assorted buttons for her sewing business

loans.name: Morny

texts.en:
Morny is petty trader in Wegbe, Hohoe. Morny has received formal education but only to the middle school level. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is in farming. 

Morny has been into petty trading for 14 years now. She supports her husband to pay for their children's school fees and also feed the home. Her loan will be used to buy plastic rubber containers, plates, and also deal in the sales of fresh fish since the demand is high in her neighbourhood. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy plastic rubber containers and plates, as well as sell fresh fish in her neighbourhood

loans.name: Julia Paula

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Julia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Adobo de Carne para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación,  Julia se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene una pequeña parcela donde cultiva tuna, Julia trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Julia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y cubrirá los gastos de riego de su cultivo, de esta manera Julia obtendrá una buena cosecha, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 48 year old woman, and she lives in the city of Nazca.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She devotes all of her efforts towards getting ahead.

Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and out of the need to work in order to help her parents when she was very young, Julia was not able to study for a professional career.

In her free time she likes to entertain herself by watching television.  Sometimes she cooks the delicious ‘Adobo de Carne’ [marinated pork in sauce] to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with great determination and dedication, Julia works in agriculture.  She has a small piece of land where she grows prickly pear cactus.  Julia works every day doing the field work, and she can do it for approximately eight hours.  She feels good doing her work, and she believes that it is going well for her because of her experience and the kind way that she treats others.

Julia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her, she will be able to buy manure and fertilizers.  She will also be able to cover the irrigation expenses for her crop.  This way Julia will get a good harvest.  She will continue working and putting forth effort in order to manage to fulfill her big dream of being able to increase her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers, and to cover the irrigation costs.

loans.name: Manzana Flat Group

texts.es:
Doña Anastacia es una mujer alegra y emprendedora y vive en el municipio de  Tierra Blanca algunas otras personas conocen este lugar como la Novia del Sol ya que en verano los calores son muy fuertes, las principales fuentes de empleo son el comercio y la ganadería. 

Doña Anastacia es integrante de un Grupo llamado La manzana, el cual esta integrado por 5 personas y cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad orientada al comercio.

Doña Anastacia desde hace 9 años tiene un pequeño establecimiento en el cual vende material de construcción y refacciones, ella nos dice que decidió poner este negocio para crear una funte de empleo para su familia y porque es muy rentable ya que siempre la gente construye sus casas o le hace reparaciones. 

ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que con el paso de los años esta prosperando y le da empleo a ella y ha su esposo, ademas de que siempre trata con personas y tiene oportunidad de hacer amistades.

un crédito de Visión Fund le ayudara a invertir en la compra de tuberías de pvc y material de acero para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que a futuro su negocio este mas surtido para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Elavures venta de abarrotes,
Santos cocina económica,
Perfecta venta de frutas y legumbres
Cruz venta de papelería.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a joyful and enterprising woman who works in the town of Tierra Blanca. Other people know this place as "Novia del Sol" because in the summer it gets very hot. The main sources of employment are business and ranching. Anastacia is a member of La Manzana group, which is made up of five members, and each one of them has a business. 

For nine years, Anastacia has had a small establishment where she sells construction materials and replacement parts. She tells us that she decided to start this business to create a source of employment for her family and because it is very profitable, since people are always building their homes and making repairs. She is very happy with her business, since over time it has prospered and provides employment for her and her husband. Also, she always deals with people and has the chance to make friends. A loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy PVC piping and steel to sell. She hopes to have a better-stocked store in the future to provide better service for her customers.

The other group members are: Elavures, who sells groceries; Santos, who sells food at good prices; Perfecta, who sells fruits and legumes; and Cruz, who sells stationery.

loans.use: to buy PVC piping and steel.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 29, lives in Vale District with his 47-year-old mother, Ketevan. He is an artisan, working on construction sites and house renovations for private clients. His monthly salary is small and is the only source of income for the family.

George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

George then requested a 1500 GEL start-up loan from Credo. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to low incomes.

George wants to develop his farm, so with his loan he will purchase piglets. Ketevan will look after and raise them. When they are grown, some of the pigs will be sold for their meat, and with some of the profits he will get more piglets. This way he will be able to expand his farming and have a profitable family business. This new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo will significantly improve the living conditions of George’s family.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en: Faisal is 29 years old and has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has completed a diploma. He is a driver who has owned a bus for four years. He works hard to provide for his family's daily expenses, however the amount that he earns is low. He would like to buy spare parts to repair his bus but he doesn't have money. So, he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. With this loan his business will run well and he will be able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his bus

loans.name: Abduljalil Group

texts.en:
Abduljalil group consists of four ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Huda is a 28-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. She is a hardworking housewife who aims to improve her living standards even though her house is vulnerable to falling down at any time. It is known that such things require a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is in short of money. She needs to complete the renovation tasks, so she has asked for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for the house. She wishes to buy furniture to use for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house

loans.name: Akubia

texts.en:
Akubia is a local chemist located at Wegbe, Hohoe. Akubia has received education to middle school level.  She is widow and has three children. Akubia had been a local chemist along with her late husband for the past 32 years, which they did together to support the family.

Akubia is responsible for the general upkeep of herself and her three children; hence, she decided to take a loan to keep the business going after she lost her husband. Her loan will be used to buy assorted drugs for sale. She hopes to save and use her new profits from her business for her old age.

loans.use: to buy assorted drugs for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 40-year-old married woman. She has one son who is one year old. She describes herself as a respectful and accommodating woman. 

Esther operates a general store where she sells home products such as flour, cooking fat, margarine, and cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a densely populated area.

She describes her biggest business challenges as the high price of home products and insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy home products. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, salt, and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, age 61, is a dairy farmer. He has been engaged in this business for 15 years. His customers are local residents and retailers. He and his wife have seven children between the ages of 10 and 29 years old. 

He has applied for a loan in order to buy animal feed and construct a cow shed. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to buy more cows. He is a goal-oriented man and sees himself as becoming more successful in five years time. 

This is Wilson's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal fees and construct a cowshed

loans.name: Africa One Group

texts.en:
Ibrahimu, who is in his early 30s, is a photographer. He has been engaged in his photography business for the past 10 years and offers a broad scope of services. With his strong skills and solid experience, Ibrahimu is doing well in his business. He works from 8 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a profit each month. He and his wife have one son who is still very young.
 
This will be Ibrahimu's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use his loan funds to buy a projector to improve his photography business. He dreams eventually of owning a studio carriage for video production. 

Ibrahimu will share this loan with his loan group, named Africa One, which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a projector to improve his photography business

loans.name: Kitombo

texts.en:
Kitombo is a 50-year-old vendor of assorted goods in Mikindani, Mombasa. He is married and a father of two children. He has done this business for a period of eight years and he is doing great. He earns a monthly income of 19,800 Kenyan shillings. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his sixth loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase more stock of torches and wrist watches, and plans to employ one youth to help him in selling with ease.

He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle. He hopes to have a big profitable business that will enable him to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of torches and wrist watches, and to employ one youth to help him in selling with ease

loans.name: Williminah

texts.en: Williminah is a married woman and has 2 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a store that sells used clothes to customers. Her business is located in an urban area where there are many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expansion. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more used clothes for selling. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business and meet public demand. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ma.leonora Theresa

texts.en:
Margaret Leonora Theresa, age 42, runs a general store business to earn an income. She and her husband live happily in a rural community with their three children. 

Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her general store in order to generate sufficient income to help her husband in financing the education of the children. She plans to increase her product offerings in order to satisfy her customers' demand. As she currently has inadequate capital for this investment, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds buy more stocks of rice, grocery items, charcoal, and pre-paid phone cards to offer for sale. 

Margaret Leonora Theresa is confident that she will be able to improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy rice, grocery items, charcoal, and pre-paid phone cards to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin is a single man. He describes himself to be good person. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. His business is located in an urban area where customers are many. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to to buy a motorbike. His business goal is to have 10 motorbikes within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid successfully

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Awanyo

texts.en: Awanyo is married and has one child. She has never received any formal schooling. Awanyo is a petty trader and also a food vendor at Wegbe, Hohoe, which she has done since 2009. Her husband is a farmer. Awanyo uses her income to help her husband provide with the basic needs of the home. Awanyo will use the loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, gari, and a gallon of oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Awanyo plans to save for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, gari for sale, gallon of oil.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with four children. She is into palm oil production in Wegbe, Hohoe, which she has done since 2008 after she got married and realized her husband's finances alone couldn’t keep the home going. Her husband is a driver. Rose uses her income to assist in catering for the home. Rose will use the loan to purchase firewood and heads of palm fruit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save and acquire a bigger pot for larger production. To prepare palm oil locally, she washes the palm fruit and boils it until it becomes soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and gently pounds it with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. She then scoops the pounded fruit into a bowl. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and the chaff removed. The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires. The juice is boiled again and as it boils, the fresh oil will float to the surface of the pot. The oil is fetched from the surface, put into another pot, and left to cool.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and heads of palm fruit.

loans.name: Hartone

texts.en: Hartone is a married man who has been a rabbit farmer for three years. His customers are local residents. Hartone faces the challenge of insufficient funds to run his farming business. He plans to use the requested loan to buy rabbit feeds. Hartone will use the anticipated profits to buy his own house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is a honest man, and he hopes to own a big rabbit farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy rabbit feeds

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia has since repaid her previous loans successfully and this marks her third borrowing. She will use the loan to renovate her food stall and parking yard for her clients. She hopes to continue serving her clients well, since the parking yard will also be rented at night for those who do not have car parking but have cars. She hopes to prosper in both her businesses.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall and parking yard for her clients

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina, 45, is a very hardworking person who is devoted to her family. She has a piggery business that serves as a source of income. She began this business in order to generate enough income to support her children. Presently, she is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins for her pigs. This amount will be a big help in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth Aracely

texts.es:
Elizabeth, 50 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Managua casada, madre de 9 hijos de los cuales tiene a cargo solos dos hijos menores de 14 y 8 años de edad los demás son independientes. Ella es costurera, este oficio lo aprendió por medio de su mama, tenían 27 años cuando comenzó a coser ropa, sus primeras piezas fueron cubre colchón, sabanas, fundas para almohadas poco a poco fue mejorando y aprendiendo a elaborar más piezas. Actualmente elabora  faldas, short, camisetas, pantalones, uniformes escolares y deportivos, vestidos etc. Además de eso realiza adornos para eventos tales como el dia de la madre, día del padre, cumpleaños. 
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar tela, agujas, elástico, hilos, botones, encajes, esta  inversión le permitirá tener más materia prima para trabajar, producir más ella tiene como visión lograr poner un taller de costura donde pueda dar empleos a más personas trabajando con máquinas de coser modernas.
texts.en:
