* All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different breads and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Dúo El Atardecer Group

texts.es:
Duo el Atardecer:
Este duo esta conformado por Sandra de 29 años de edad es casada y madre de familia Reina trabaja para poder mantener a su madre quien esta enferma, Reina tiene un puesto de frutas y verdura en el mercado local de Sumpango, ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en verdura y frutas para la venta, espera que por medio de ustedes atravez del credito y asi ella pueda salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Atardecer Duo

This duo is made up of 29 year old Sandra, married and a mother, and Reina who works to support her sick mother.  Reina sells fruits and vegetables from a stall in the local Sumpango market and has been doing this for eight years.  She is asking for this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.  She hopes to get ahead in her business with your help and a loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es: evelyn de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en su lugar de su residencia es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old and lives with her husband in a home of her own.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products, such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things.  She has had her business for many years and this has provided her with the experience she needs to obtain better earnings.  The store is located in her home and she is well known by the residents in the zone.  She has gained many customers and has a well-stocked store.  She wants to grow her business and make another investment, but she needs working capital so she can buy what she needs for her store.  She assures us that she will pay off the loan and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Nahuen Pullu Group

texts.es: Los socios del Banco Comunal Nuhuen Pullu tienen distintos negocios tales como repostería, venta de joyas, venta de cremas, peluquerías y Marcela, que está ubicada al costado derecho de la foto con una chaqueta roja, que es nuestra entrevistada tiene un almacén de abarrotes, que empezó hace ya dos años, y tomó esta decisión ya que le era imposible tener un trabajo fuera de su hogar por tener su hijo pequeño. El problema que siempre ha tenido es no contar con el dinero suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos que tiene o poder comprar más insumos para su negocio, aunque siempre ha sido un gran apoyo su familia. Con el dinero que recibirá podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio y lo demás lo ahorrará por cualquier imprevisto que pueda ocurrir. Ella está muy contenta porque sabe que tendrá un buen periodo si recibe este dinero, aunque hace poco abrió cerca de su negocio, está entusiasmada porque así podrá irse renovando y pensando en buenas ideas para atraer más clientes. Lo que más le ha gustado de participar en Fondo Esperanza es el trabajo en grupo que hay, porque ella conformo un Banco con vecinas, y todas se conocen lo que hace mucho mas agradable y entretenida esta experiencia.
texts.en:
The members of the Nuhuen Pullu communal bank have different businesses such as pastries, jewelry sales, cream sales, and barber shops.  Marcela, to the right of the photo, wearing a red jacket, has a grocery store that she started two years ago.  She decided to do this because it was impossible for her to work outside the home with her young son.  The problem she has always had is not having enough money to be able to cover all expenses and buy more inventory for her business, although her family has always been very supportive.

The money from this loan will allow her to buy more merchandise and she will save the rest for any unplanned needs that may occur.  She is very happy because she knows that she will have a good period if she receives this money.  She is excited because she will be able to renovate and come up with new ways to attract more customers.  What she enjoys most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the work with the group because she joined a bank with her neighbors and they all know one another, which makes this experience more satisfying and fun.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con mucho esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante y se esfuerza por crecer. Cuenta que tiene muy buena experiencia en el ramo ya que lleva mucho tiempo en el. Comenta tambien que gracias al credito anterior de kiva ha podido mejorar mucho y seguir creciendo. La meta de Cristina es poder seguir ampliando su local.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carnes, frutas, bebidas, verduras y demás insumos y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas. Agradece la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow.  She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for a long time.  She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow.  Cristina’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things for her store so she can continue her sales.  She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Evelin Beatriz

texts.es: evelin de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz, frijol y hortalizas con las ganancias que obtine de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, evelin necesita comprar insumos agricolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, pesticidas, entre otras cosas pero no tiene capital para realizarlo por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar lo antes mencionado y asi ella pueda tener mejores y buenas cosechas y para obtener mas ganancias que le ayudaran con los gastos de su hogar y podra darle a su familia un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Evelin is 31 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She farms the land and sows corn, beans, and vegetables, and with the money she makes from sales manages to cover the household expenses. Evelin needs to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, manure, seeds, pesticides, among other things, but she does not have the money to do so. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy the things previously mentioned and, as a result, obtain better harvests. If she makes more profit, she will be able to help out more with household expenses and give her family a more stable financial situation

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz, maicillo y tambien al cultivo de jocotes, desde hace 10 años, es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y dedicado en su trabajo, vende sus cultivos con los comerciates de granos basicos cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos de los gastos que tiene en su hogar. Don benito desea comprar fertilizantesn semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener una mejor cosecha por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar lo antes mencionado y asi el pueda tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Benito, 65, lives in his own house with his family.  He has made a living for 10 years growing basic grains such as corn and millet.  He also grows jocote [a fruit that's also known as mombin].

He's a very responsible and honest man who's dedicated to his job.  He sells his crops to the grain merchants near his home.  He's able to cover some of his household expenses with his profits.

Benito wants to buy fertilizer, seed, soil amendments, and other things to have a better harvest.  This is why he's requesting a loan that will allow him to buy those supplies and have better income and greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizer, soil amendments, seed, etc.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 3 años ella se ha dedicado al negocio de elaboración y venta de tabletas de coco, tortillas y venta de refrescos. Ha tenido dos ciclos de préstamos en ODEF y con buen record, ahora solicita el tercer préstamo por 14,000 lempiras para comprar una refrigeradora para el negocio y arreglar unas ventanas de su casa. Con las ganancias piensa hacer el piso a su casa. Su meta es lograr que sus hijos se gradúen y hacer crecer más el negocio.
texts.en: Norma is 34 years old and a single mother with six children.  She lives in a suburb of Choloma, Cortes and has been making and selling chocolates, tortillas, and soft drinks.  She has had two previous loan cycles through ODEF and has a good record.  Now she is asking for a loan of 14,000 Lempiras so she can buy a refrigerator for her business and fix the windows in her home.  She plans to install a floor in her home with her earnings.  Her goal is to ensure that her children graduate and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business and make some home improvements.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 24-year-old unmarried woman, who has been working in the beauty business for five years. Three years ago, her father helped her in starting her own business by giving her his own shop to turn into an attractive beauty salon of her own.

Rasha is a hard worker and is well-known in the region for her special talent in her domain. To continue to meet her customers' requests, she is applying for a youth loan from Kiva Field Partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a newly released nail color collection. She also needs to pay for preparations for her wedding, which is going to be soon.

Rasha is planning to keep on expanding and developing her business to keep her customers satisfied and to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy a newly released nail color collection and pay for her wedding preparations.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 59-year-old farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 30 years now. This is her source of income.

Bonifacia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest, thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Enes

texts.en:
Enes is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from three to seven years. She describes herself as honest and reliable. She operates a M-Pesa business (a mobile-phone-based money-transfer service) where she offers transaction services to customers either withdrawing or depositing. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area where customers are many.

Enes describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital to grow the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to to start offering printing services in the M-Pesa business. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, it will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to start offering printing services in her M-Pesa business.

loans.name: Maynor David

texts.es: Maynor, 31 años es habitante de la ciudad de León, viudo, padre de un 1 hijo , el es dueño de un pequeño Cyber café.El inicio con este negocio para ejercer el curso que el aprendió como técnico en computación empezó con dos computadoras ahora tiene 11 computadoras y vende artículos escolares, se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindo Kiva y MiCredito atraves del financiamiento pues ha ido mejorando, tiene mas computadoras, teclados, mouse. Como una forma mas de conseguir nuevos ingreso desea poner una libreria que es para lo cual desea usar este financimiento para comprar,cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices de colores, marcadores, libretas, clips, borradores etc. Pues desea ampliar este negocio y convertirlo en una librería bien surtida y con capacidad de atender a más clientes en su Cyber café con PC nuevas y veloces pues la mayoría de su clientela son jóvenes que siempre buscan maquinas buenas y articulos escolares.
texts.en: Maynor is 31 years old and lives in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. He is widowed and has one son. He is the owner of a small internet café. He started this business in order to put into practice what he learned on a course to become a computer technician. He started off with two computers and now has 11 and he sells school stationery supplies as well. He is grateful for the help that Kiva and MiCredito are offering him, and through their financing his business has been improving. He has more computers, keyboards, and mouses. To increase his income, he has decided to start a stationery store, and that is why he is requesting the loan so that he can buy notebooks, pencil cases, colored pencils, highlighters, paperclips, and erasers, etc. He wants to grow his business and turn it into a well-stocked stationery store as well as improving his cyber café with newer and faster PCs since most of his clientele are young people who are always looking for good computers and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencil cases, colored pencils, highlighters, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses and smart pants for men and women.

loans.name: Eleazar Belarmino

texts.es:
Eleazar, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. El vive con su familia, su esposa y sus dos hijo, el trabaja en el hogar y no tiene familiares en el extranjero; la actividad la aprendió desde muy  joven, no posee horario establecido.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar tres cerdos  para engordarlos y luego venderlos; esta inversión le servirá para crecer  y tener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es tener casa propia y  prepara académicamente a sus hijos.
texts.en: Eleazar works in agriculture and livestock. He lives with his family, his wife and his two children. He works the land and does not have any family overseas. He learned this trade when he was very young and he does not have a regular schedule. He is requesting the loan to buy three pigs to fatten and sell, and this investment will help him to grow and have a better income. His dream is to have his own home and to be able to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
María, posee una granja de pollos. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo y sus hijos, estos son los que trabajan en el hogar; no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El negocio lo aprendió de sus hermanos quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo, no tiene ningún horario establecido
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de 200 pollos, alimento, vitaminas y para hacerle mejoraras a su vivienda; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mejores instalaciones de la granja y tendrá todo lo necesario para trabajar. 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y aportar a sus hijos para que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en: Maria has a chicken farm. She lives with her family, her husband, and their children. They look after themselves because they do not have any family overseas. She learned this business from her brothers who worked doing the same thing. She does not have a regular schedule. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of 200 chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins to be able to make improvements to her home. The loan will help her to improve the condition of the farm and to purchase what she needs to work. Her dream is to have a bigger business and be able to support her children so that they can study to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 56 years old, married, with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish-vending business, using the boat to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns PHP 8,000 every month. 

She has been with Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) since 2010 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fishing materials, such as nets and hooks. Lorie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, such as nets and hooks.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 51. She is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Samuel, her business partner and the father of her children. She, with help from her husband and children, manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Melinda operates a buy-and-sell business. She sells piaya, a flat unleavened bread filled with muscovado sugar. It is a famous delicacy in the sugarcane capital of the country, Negros Occidental. She earns a minimum of 4,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she requests an 8,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more piaya. 

Melinda dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more piaya to sell.

loans.name: Khaldon

texts.en:
Khaldon is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Aden, Yemen. He has been running a cosmetic materials and perfumes business for seven months and has done well in his business. He feels very proud because, with a lot of effort and hard work, he has been able to succeed with his business. 

He is requesting a youth loan so that he can further stock his business with creams, perfumes and all kinds of makeup. This will enable him to make more income for his family.

loans.use: to stock his business with creams, perfumes and all kinds of makeup.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
This is Mary Jean, 36, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a factory worker and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide a good future for their whole family.

Mary Jean operates a manufacturing business. What she basically does is buy garments from textile factory, makes rugs and door mats out of them and sell them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are housewives and jeepney drivers. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more cloth, threads, needles, and other products needed in making rugs and door mats. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Jean hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and provide a good future to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional inventory (e.g., cloth, threads, needles, and other products) needed in the rug-making industry.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her grocery store. She has been in this business for six years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan so as to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou dreams of a continuous growth of her business and hopes to improve their living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. The fellowship group is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
This is Lynette, 53, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lynette operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lynette dreams of expanding her junk shop and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Sonia would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies of tailoring materials like cloth, fabric, needles, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sonia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials like different types of fabric, needles, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
This is Eddie. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more computers and video cards. He can now accommodate more customers. He is in this business for two years now. He is helping his parents in providing income for their family.

He would like to apply for a 27,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to buy one computer, video cards and sound cards. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Eddie dreams to expand his business and hopes to finish his studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group consists of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional computer, video cards and sound cards for his computer shop.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 34, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and she works hard to provide for her everyday needs and expenses.
Mary Grace offers massage. She already has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She does home service. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy oil, towel, lotion and other stuff that she needs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Grace dreams to have her own parlor and hopes that her nieces and nephews will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for things needed in massage like oil, towel, lotion and other stuff that she needs.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 25 years old, lives with his wife, son and father in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working at the police department for seven consecutive years, and he enjoys being a policeman despite the low earnings it provides. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. The natural gas car has advantages such as less fuel wastage and cleaner air pollutants. The automobile will be used for a taxi service as an additional income generator. During his day off, he wants to earn money by rendering taxi service to local people. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Cherry Gil

texts.en:
Cherry Gil is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Cherry Gil runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Cherry Gil wants to expand her business, but lacks the capital to do so. For this reason, she joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to the micro entrepreneurs like her. She is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soap and toiletries and other items. With this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Cherry Gil has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soap and toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is recognized as a responsible mother of nine children. At age 62, Virginia is still determined to work hard to lift her family from poor living. She is married to Rogelio, a farmer in the village of Sto. Niňo, Angadanan.

Virginia is engaged in selling bananas. She usually buys them in the market and sells them in their village. As of now, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy more bananas to re-sell. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will improve her business and make it a viable and profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to re-sell.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
A $ 1.200.00 loan is offered to Juvita to improve her business.Juvita opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, Dancow milk and soft drinks, including Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta and others. Juvita is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.Juvita is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, Dancow milk and soft drinks, including Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta and others.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato has been a hog-raiser for five years. Aside from his hog-raising business, he also manages the family farmland. He works hard to give his family a better life.

Right now, Renato needs additional capital to improve his hog-raising business. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina has been engaged in a hog raising business for seven years. Aside from raising hogs, she is also a vendor of dried fish and involved in a farming business. Carolina's gained income goes toward their daily needs, maintenance of farming and allowances for her two children.

Carolina is married with six children. Three of them have settled down to marriage and have their own families; two are still studying and the other one is an Overseas Filipino Worker(OFW). The couple aspire to have a profitable business, so they can cover all their household expenses and send their two children on to a higher level of education. To make her dreams possible, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000, which allows her to buy bags of hog feed and essential vitamins for her hogs.She knows that through this amount of loan, she could ensure her hogs proper nutrition, which enables her to obtain a greater income. Carolina is hoping for further smooth grow of her hog raising and other businesses for her to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy bags of hog feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is 34 years old and has a sari-sari (general) store. She has had her business for four years. It is located in front of her house and offers sugar, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce and detergent soap for sale. Her husband works as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They are helping each other to increase the quality of their living conditions, as well as preparing for the future for their only child. Aileen doesn’t want her child to not finish education like her. For her to achieve her dream, she decided to request a loan of 20,000 pesos to purchase additional merchandise for resale, such as cooking oil, snacks, candies, soft drinks and bread, for her store to be able to offer its customers an improved variety of items.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for resale, such as cooking oil, snacks, candies, soft drinks and bread.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been running her 2.5 hectares of rice field for 23 years. She is thankful because through her hard work and patience she has been able to improve her rice crop production.

Lolita is a married woman who is blessed with four children. She is thankful because her spouse is supportive in running their farm, as well as her school canteen and viand business. Lolita wants to continue to improve her rice field through proper care and supplying her farm plot with necessary farm inputs. But due to a shortage of capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000, which would allow her to buy two bags of seedlings, seven bags of fertilizer, and two liters of insecticides to ensure proper growth of her crops. She hopes to obtain this loan to earn a better income and help her two children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy two bags of seedlings,seven bags of fertilizer, and two liters of insecticides to ensure proper growth of her crops

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of products, such as foods, detergents and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, such as foods, detergents and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Under a wooden house located in Kror Kor district, Sam is 31 years old and the mother of three children. All of her children still rely on her as two of them are still in school and one is too young for schooling. One and a half hectares of rice cropping and firewood selling, which are managed by her and her husband, are the main sources of family income. The current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day. Sam has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is seeking her first loan in order to build a house for her family, especially for her kids. She hopes to own a decent house as others to live in.

loans.use: To build a house for her family

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Tony is 41 years old and married, with two children, both of whom are still small. 

To make a living, the main sources of the family’s income are corn and banana growing; her husband supplements the income by working as a paid worker in Thailand. Having engaged in this business for 20 years, she and her husband can earn about USD 13 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Tony’s first loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she is asking for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her growing business. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her crop production and to sell the crops for a good price, to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her growing business.

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en: Soeurng, 48 and a mother of 4 children, is a peasant from Battambang province. She has one and a half hectares of land for rice cropping and red corn farming. Soeurng is able to earn about 42,000 KHR per day, which she has been doing for eight years as the main source of her family’s income. Her main challenge in running her current business is the shortage of working capital. Therefore, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. This is the first loan for Soeurng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each while the remaining member is applying for 650,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, seeds, and insecticide, and to plow her farmland. She hopes this purchase will help her to boost her crop productivity on time and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy potash, seeds, and insecticide, and to plow her farmland

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 42-year-old married woman from Ubay,Bohol. She has six children. The eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 4 months old. 

She engages in a buy and sell business. She buys and sells mats. The mats, locally known as "banig," are handwoven and made of palm and are used for sleeping and sitting. 

Susan requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more handwoven mats for buy and sell business. In the future, Susan would like to expand her business to support her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more  hand woven mats for buy and sell business

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro earns a living through his hog raising business. He is married and has two children. 

Teodoro wants to expand his business, but lacks the resources to do so. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, he will be able to improve his business and increase his revenue, allowing him to meet the needs of his family.

Teodoro dreams of investing more in this business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en: Bernabe is a 39-year-old fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and father of four children. Bernabe is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and others. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Bernabe has hopes of making his business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and others

loans.name: Voun's Group

texts.en:
Age 23, Voun is a married mother of one daughter who lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district in the province of Battambang in Cambodia. Rice farming and sesame growing are the main sources of the family’s income. Voun earns about 21,000 KHR per day but she also saves about 15,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Voun has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle, and she completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Voun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en: Valerio has been engaged in a copra production business for more than 20 years now.  He is a married man from Corella, Bohol, and has seven children. Valerio works hard to earn a living in order to support his family and their needs. He is asking for a loan to buy more coconut for copra making. With this, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Valerio hopes to make his business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for copra making

loans.name: Khy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khy is aged 43 years and is married. She has four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for almost thirty years. Her family’s income is about 31,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Khy received her first loan three cycles ago and she completely paid back the loans. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her family significantly improve their standard of living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Khy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline for her farmland.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana lives in Carlos P. Garcia, Ubay, Bohol.  She is married with three children ages 12, 14 and 16.
Luciana has a Sari-sari store business (general store) where she sells basic household commodities like detergent,  cooking oil, canned sardines, noodles and candies. She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy additional items like seasoning, shampoo in sachet, bath soap, toothpaste and chips. She is determined to make a success in her business. In the future, she hopes to continue to expand her business and send her children to school for their better future.

loans.use: to buy seasoning, shampoo in sachet, bath soap, toothpaste and chips

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Khon is 35 years old and married. She is a citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, where farming is a common way to earn a living. She has five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school.  

She and her husband have struggled to support the family by farming rice and selling ice cream. She has been in the business for 10 years, and  business currently earns her approximately 35,000 KHR per day.

Khon is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, in this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to expand her farming business so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosario has been in this business for 10 years. Rosario earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.
She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vehicle transport. Janet is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.
Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Menrose

texts.en:
Menrose is 33 years old and married with two children.

Menrose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as laundry soap, noodles, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Menrose has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Menrose aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as laundry soap, noodles, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Riechielyn

texts.en:
Riechielyn works hard to support her family. Riechielyn is married and has a fish selling business in the Philippines.

Riechielyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Kiva partner Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Riechielyn has been in this business for eight years now.

Riechielyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 52 years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rosalita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to pay for the laborer's salaries and to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalita has been farming sugarcane for 13 years and also earns additional income from food selling and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the laborer's salaries and to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 45 years old, is married, and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Magdalena has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, blouses, shoes, underwear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Maria Magdalena has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to help ensure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, blouses, shoes, underwear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda has been pig-fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 59 years old, married, and has six children. She works in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Luciana has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Luciana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to purchase farm land for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Tuni

texts.en:
Tuni is a 44-year-old widow living with her two sons in a village of Odisha, India. She has a small grocery shop at her house from which she earns 2,000 India Rupees (INR) per month.

One of Tuni's sons is studying and the other one had to drop out of college to support Tuni in running their family. Her elder son, who had to drop out of college to share her mother’s burden, started working as a daily labor. They are able to make 5,000 INR in a month after her son’s contribution. She is worried that her other son, who is still in college, might have to drop out as well if her financial situation does not improve.

Her shop is the only shop for the 50 families living near her house in the village. She says that she feels good about making some daily household needs accessible to her customers without them having to travel far.

She sells grains, lentils, rice, wheat, biscuits, wafers, etc. in her grocery store, but she is not able to reach the customers' demands, and so she has requested a loan of 25,000 INR. She wants to purchase the grocery items like lentils, rice, wheat, biscuits, wafers, etc. in bulk amounts. There is not enough stock available in her store, where the demand is high. Tuni’s dream is to see her son continue college and give them a good quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for lentils, rice, wheat, biscuits, wafers, etc.in bulk amounts for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 10 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and reliable. 

She operates a tailoring business where she repairs clothes and makes new clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an rural area where customers are many. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use this loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful and educate her children. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a widowed woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 10 to 20 years old. She describes herself to be honest and reliable. She operates a general store business where she sells clothes, padlocks and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area where customers are many. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more padlocks, nets and clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business to wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more padlocks, nets and clothes to sell

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en: Jingle is 34 years old, married and has two infant-age children. Being a responsible parent, he aimed to become financially stable in order to support his family. He is raising his family in a rural community and they live through farming. Aside from this, he engages in furniture making to earn additional income. He planned to improve and strengthen this business to make it more profitable but he has inadequate capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy wood, nails, a hammer and other materials needed in furniture making. He is hoping that his loan will be granted to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, a hammer and other materials needed in furniture making

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Sudi, who is in his late 30s, is married with two sons who are still going to school. He has had a motorcycle for transport business for 2 years now. He works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sudi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy his bodaboda (motorcycle) business. He has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to buy a TV set, paid school fees, and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to take the motorcycle for service and to put a new board on the motorcycle. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Sudi will share this loan with his loan group "MAENDELEO" with 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to take his motorcycle for service and to put a new board on the motorcycle.

loans.name: Chepkwony

texts.en: Chepkwony operates a video show shop and has done this for three years. He plans to use the loan to open a new theater so he has enough space for his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to grow his business. He hopes to have a branch network in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes that in five years time he will be operating a cyber cafe.

loans.use: to open a new theatre

loans.name: Nlonya

texts.en:
N’lonya is a married woman who is 39 years old. She has three kids who attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

N’lonya has operated a retail shop business, selling to local neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by debtors in her business. She dreams of expanding her business premises in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 to 10 years. She describes herself to be honest and reliable. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, eggs, fish, tomatoes and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a rural area where customers are numerous. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that some of the groceries are perishable. She will use the 20,000-KES loan to to add stock of kale, eggs and fish to sell. Her business goal is to open a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of kale, eggs and fish to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a coconut wine vendor from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown children. Her husband is a fisherman. Coconut wine can also be fermented into a vinegar.

Cristina is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine to sell. With this, she will be able to sell more and earn more. Cristina hopes to improve her business and explore another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, 39, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality and delayed payments as the challenges in her business.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase maize, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and sugar

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 27-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working in the transportation business for two years. He is a school bus driver, well known in his region with his good reputation and special care and safety he provides to his customers.

Maher is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to perform necessary maintenance on his bus to keep it in a good situation since it is his only source of income for living. He will invest part of the loan to continue building a one-room apartment to rent as additional income. He hopes to keep on providing his lovely family with a good living and a good education.

loans.use: To perform necessary maintenance on his bus

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu, age 35, is married and a mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past 4 years, she has operated a cereal selling business, selling household consumables for resale. She also operates a fuel selling business, which is her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in the business.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans; and fuel for cooking. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans; and fuel for cooking.

loans.name: Sapina

texts.en: Spina is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas and other items that she can sell in her community or in the market. She has been doing this for three years. Sapina needs a loan to improve her home conditions and buy fertilizer, chemicals, wheel barrow, shovels, and gloves for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Sapina will use the profits from her sales to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, wheel barrow, shovels, and gloves

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and has four children. She has received some schooling; she attended until the end of primary school. Currently, Monica sells plastic bowls and plastic containers in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this business activity for about three years. Her husband works with a rubber manufacturing company. Monica's income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general living expenses.

Monica will use the loan to increase her existing plastic container inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Monica plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing plastic containers inventory.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is a 52-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years. This is the source of their income. Epifania is asking for a loan to purchase a new fishing boat. Through this her husband will be able to improve his fishing thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Diloromjon

texts.en: Diloromjon is kind woman. She and her husband are happy and have two children who are 15 and 16 years old. She is very hardworking. She has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much. Diloromjon has been farming for many years producing wheat and watermelon. Her products are sold at the local market in the city. Her husband helps with business. In order to provide her growing wheat and watermelon with the needed attention, Diloromjon is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 somoni so that she can buy fertilizer and continue improving her wheat and watermelon production. She hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices being commanded on an international level so that she can maintain a better standard of living and help her children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is aged 39 years; she is married and has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a bar business selling to town dwellers and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition and high cost of transportation from her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase crates of beers and sodas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Jargalsaikhan is 46-years-old, and lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder two daughters study at university while his youngest daughter goes to high school. His wife works at American investment company and is paid on monthly basis. He has been doing construction work on contract with private business entities since 2009 and has accumulated vast amount of experience in doing this business. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase two ground diggers and breakers. This equipment will be used for a construction project on order of particular business entity. He and his squad will perform the construction work quickly and qualitatively. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase two diggers and breakers.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en: Honorata is a 57-year-old married woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business locally known as "pamanggal" with her husband for more than 20 years. Pamanggal is a different way of fishing with the use of bamboo made into traps. Honorata is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo to make fish traps. With this she will be able to make more fish traps that would be used for their fishing business. In the future, Honorata hopes of improving their business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to make fish traps.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 29-year-old married man, and the father of one child. He has been working in the construction business specializing in house painting for the past eight years. In 2007, he started working on his own to increase his income and develop his living. Kassem is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new released tools for his business in addition to new colors and types of paint. This loan will help him to develop his business and increase his income. His experience in this field has provided him with customers' trust and support; that's why he has to keep his business updated to keep on replying to his customers' needs. He hopes to provide his child with the best education, since due to his parent's financial situation he didn't have the chance to study the major of his choice.

loans.use: To buy new released tools for his business in addition to new colors and types of paint.

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en:
Ma. Violeta is a married woman and a mother of two children from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Ma. Violeta has engaged in fishing together with her husband for more than three years now.
Ma. Violeta is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing supplies. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 58-year-old married woman, and mother to seven children. Fatima is a hard working woman, who has been selling vegetables on the road side of her village for three years in order to provide her family with the basic standards of living. Fatima is the only breadwinner in her family, her husband doesn't work, that's why she is putting so much effort into developing her business to increase her income and improve her living standards.
Fatima is a applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her stock with new seasonal vegetables, which will attract her customer’s attention.
Fatima hopes to stay in good health and be capable of providing her family with their necessary needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock with new seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is aged 35 years and married. Together with her husband, she has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a poultry farming business selling wholesale to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and outbreak of diseases causing losses in the business. Chari dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed for resale.

loans.name: Ahida

texts.en:
Ahida is 49 years old. She lives in a small village of the Lagodekhi District with her husband and two daughters. Ahida requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from their sheep-breeding business. They have 40 sheep and sell lambs locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Ahida requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ahida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Ahida will purchase milking cows. After purchasing the cows she will be able to produce dairy products for selling. She will be able to expand her husbandry business and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows.

loans.name: Manelin

texts.en:
Manelin has engaged in a food vending business for more than three years now. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. Manelin works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.
Manelin is asking for a loan to buy stocks to sell like biscuits, snack foods, bread, canned goods and noodles. With this, she will be able to improve her business and eventually her income. In the future, Manelin is optimistic of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like biscuits, snack foods, bread, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lunguma est trésorière du groupe de crédit Makimbilio, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 8 enfants, qui étudient. Son conjoint est sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse des emballages (sacs). Elle est aussi couturière. Elle s’installe au marché. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle fait ces petites spéculations. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 ballon des emballages (sacs) à marchander.  Dans le future, elle souhaiter accroitre son capital et acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement l’IMF Hekima pour son projet en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The member Lunguma is treasurer of the Makimbilio credit loan group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, aged 35 and the mother of eight children, all attending school. Her husband is unemployed.

The member sells tote bags, and is also a seamstress. She sets up shop at the market. She started her business using funds received from her husband. She has been pursuing these small business activities for the past three years.

This new loan will be used to buy one bale of tote bags to resell at bargain prices. In the future, she wants to increase her working capital and buy a plot of land. Finally,she is very thankful to the Hekima IMF for its microcredit project to help small businesses.

loans.use: buy one bale of tote bags

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Munkh-Erdene, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He and his wife make Mongolian traditional boots, designed for children. They are experienced boot makers and sell them to vendors at an outdoor market. Recently they have bought land and paid one third of the land price and now the remaining payment must be paid as soon as possible. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay the land payment. As a result, his family can live in their beloved ger on their own land without worrying about rental land, as they previously rented land to reside. The borrower and his wife are very hardworking people who deeply care about their children's education.

loans.use: to make the final payment on his land.

loans.name: Ma.  Lifamy

texts.en: Ma.Lifamy is a 27-year-old married woman from the Talibon, Bohol. Ma. Lifamy is engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than four years. This is the source of their income. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma 25 years, is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Marlito

texts.en:
Marlito earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He is a married man and has two children from Getafe, Bohol. Marlito is also engaged in farming.
Marlito is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like tires, nuts and bolts and other items. With this, he will be able to improve his income and earnings. In the future, Marlito hopes of improving his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like tires, nuts and bolts and other parts.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 26-year-old divorced woman, who is working hard to provide her child the best life she can. Seven years ago, she started her own business at home as a hairdresser, to help in her family's income.

Hanan is a Palestinian refugee, and most of her customers are friends, relatives and neighbors from her region.
Her business is improving, because her customers are increasing. Hanan is putting so much effort to develop it in order to make sure that she can provide her child a good life and a high level of education.

Hanan applied for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to buy beauty items. This is her third loan with Al Majmoua. Her previous loan helped a lot in supporting her business, through the tools and equipment she bought.

Hanan started her business from home because she didn't have enough capital to open a salon. She was trying to prove that when there is a will there is a way. She confirms that she was right and she will continue working on improving and developing her business to keep her customers pleased.
She also hopes that one day she will make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy beauty items for her salon.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has operated a café business from home for the past 10 years, with passers-by and neighbors as her potential customers. She cited high cost of transportation as her major challenge.
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, rice and drinks for the café business. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, rice and drinks for the café business.
